Venthole-like craters dot the surface of a deghuun's body, through which the creature can gaze out with a single golden eye that it can move from crater to crater.

0UbSYN1Y6Sk2mfjQ.description:
Requirements The deghuun has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its tentacles

Effect The creature takes @Damage[(4d8+17)[piercing]] damage.
0UbSYN1Y6Sk2mfjQ.name: Beak Crunch

415YyiRgxhBj4QVH.description:
The deghuun vents caustic smog for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Any creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the deghuun during this time takes @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@Check[fortitude|dc:38]; the creature avoids the sickened condition on a critical success, or is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

While sickened in this way, a creature takes a -2 status penalty to its saving throw against the deghuun's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.U58aQWJ47VrI36yP]{Hallucination}.

Any creature that's in the smog is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} and treats other creatures as concealed. Strong winds dissipate the smog.
415YyiRgxhBj4QVH.name: Sulfurous Plume

7YxHt2qByZ37NDj5.description: Anytime a deghuun attempts a Will save against an enchantment spell, the spell's caster must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for up to the spell's duration.
7YxHt2qByZ37NDj5.name: Unfathomable Aspect

aGULlUDAVR1BMKC7.description: The deghuun ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke or smog, including from Sulfurous Plume.
aGULlUDAVR1BMKC7.name: Smoke Vision

m716szn1fHz5unyk.description: The deghuun makes three tentacle Strikes, each against a different creature within reach. These attacks count toward its multiple attack penalty as normal.
m716szn1fHz5unyk.name: Tentacle Assault

Deghuun (Child of Mhar).name: Deghuun (Child of Mhar)

bipIvdk7SAVNAKJV.description: Delamar draws a weapon with an Interact action, then Strikes with the weapon he just drew.
bipIvdk7SAVNAKJV.name: Quick Draw

mezWuI2AxifmZTwP.description: Delamar deals an extra 2d6 precision damage precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

oByC6W1h6qcY4eXg.description: Delamar isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 6th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.io6eJGrw701WbmYe]{Surprise Attack}.
oByC6W1h6qcY4eXg.name: Deny Advantage

tRUwzQREvBkvCsOz.description: On the first round of combat, if Delamar rolled Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to him.
tRUwzQREvBkvCsOz.name: Surprise Attack

zY6dnugGXHyrRplD.description:
Trigger A creature within Delamar's melee reach is hit by a melee attack from one of his allies

Effect Delamar makes a Strike against the triggering creature with a -2 penalty to the attack roll. He can't deal sneak attack damage on this Strike. After this Strike, Delamar can Stride without triggering reactions.
zY6dnugGXHyrRplD.name: Nimble Opportunist

Doblagub.description:
Elder brughadatches command groups of fellow brughadatches, who placate the doblagub with fresh meals and trophies of the group's grisly catches.

Brughadatches are malevolent fey tricksters with distinct stages of life: they spawn from the First World's primal energies as esurient tadpoles, grow into humanoids capable of creating enticing illusions, then finally evolve into huge, slothful toads that warp their environs with mere thoughts.

SDcOSLxZFCLOVEvk.description:
Requirements The doblagub's etheric fibers aura is active

Frequency once per round

Effect All non-brughadatch creatures within the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save or be pulled 10 feet toward the doblagub.
SDcOSLxZFCLOVEvk.name: Etheric Tug

TQoNfhkr54rzdEGA.description:
40 feet. Requirements A doblagub has bonded with their current location by being called there via a ritual or by remaining in one place for 10 years

Effect The doblagub grows etheric fibers that they can use to psychically keep prey close. Any time a creature tries to move within this aura, it must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:30] save or the movement fails and the action is wasted.
TQoNfhkr54rzdEGA.name: Etheric Fibers

ujQNaJiDY5ja5QlI.description: A doblagub can use their tongue to make spell attacks with spells that have a range of touch.
ujQNaJiDY5ja5QlI.name: Magical Tongue

Doblagub.name: Doblagub

Dream Pollen Pod.description: Four magical plants inside the wagon release hallucinogenic pollen when disturbed.
Dream Pollen Pod.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Remove Pollen Pod] (trained) to carefully remove a pollen pod or @Check[nature|dc:18|name:Prevent Pod Burst] (trained) to prevent a pod from bursting.
Dream Pollen Pod.hazardReset: The trap resets after 1 hour, when the pods have regrown additional pollen. If all the pods are removed or disabled, the trap doesn't reset.
Dream Pollen Pod.hazardRoutine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each removed or disabled pollen pod. The trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Dream Pollen Pod.name: Dream Pollen Pod

BFPXxBgFh6cenPgG.description: Magical rusting effects, like a rust monster's antennae, affect the iron golem normally.
BFPXxBgFh6cenPgG.name: Vulnerable to Rust

Ou7j9iRSTfEmOPJq.description:
harmed by acid ([[/r {6d10}]] damage, [[/r {2d8}]] damage from areas or persistent damage); healed by fire (area @Damage[2d8[healing]] Hit Points); slowed by electricity

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. These exceptions are listed in shortened form in the golem's stat block, with the full rules appearing here. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem.

  • Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.
  • Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.
  • Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's slowed 1 for that round.
  • Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.
Ou7j9iRSTfEmOPJq.name: Golem Antimagic

ThFBVTrezGFEC7SU.description: Casting @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction} on the golem deactivates its Breath Weapon for 1 minute.
ThFBVTrezGFEC7SU.name: Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison

UxbAHJiUJAsFm4cq.description:
The iron golem exhales poisonous gas in a @Template[burst|distance:10]{10-foot radius} centered on the corner of one of the iron golem's squares.

The gas persists for 1 round. Any creature in the area (or that later enters the area) is exposed to the iron golem's poison.

The golem can't use its Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.
UxbAHJiUJAsFm4cq.name: Breath Weapon

Y0ySCcnmHvN9oQCd.description:
Any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} value from this poison is reduced by 1 every hour.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:35]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 round)
Y0ySCcnmHvN9oQCd.name: Iron Golem Poison

x8bFDzkhGGqdhVb2.description: The iron golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a @Check[fortitude|dc:39|traits:damaging-effect] save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise, it is damaged as if hit by the golem's fist.
x8bFDzkhGGqdhVb2.name: Inexorable March

CmEN8uWFDeuYp1rP.description: The drunken brawler uses an Interact action to pick up an improvised weapon within reach and then Strikes with it. The drunken brawler has a +2 circumstance bonus to this attack.
CmEN8uWFDeuYp1rP.name: Improvised Surprise

ZV6wTo1kAYTI9DlU.description:
Requirements The drunken brawler isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or raging

Effect The drunken brawler begins raging. They gain 4 temporary Hit Points and deal 1 additional damage with fist Strikes. They have a -1 penalty to AC and can't use actions with the concentrate trait unless those actions also have the rage trait. The drunken brawler can still @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} while in a drunken rage. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the drunken brawler falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, whichever comes first. When the drunken rage is over, the drunken brawler is fatigued, loses all temporary Hit Points they received from the rage, and cannot rage again for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}
ZV6wTo1kAYTI9DlU.name: Drunken Rage

1Aoz2hUdk0inH018.description: Dyzallin has an undead raven named Grimbeak as a familiar. Grimbeak can fly, has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.TTCw5NusiSSkJU1x]{Void Healing}, shares all of Dyzallin's immunities, and grants him an additional 7th-rank spell slot (already incorporated into the stat block).
1Aoz2hUdk0inH018.name: Familiar

39iXJ3VDAsZ4Ij0P.description:
30 feet. Living creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} while in Dyzallin's utter despair aura. They can't naturally recover from this fear while in the area but lose the frightened condition immediately upon leaving the area.

When a creature first enters the aura, it must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:39|traits:incapacitation] save (after taking the penalty from being frightened) or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

The creature is then temporarily immune to the paralysis caused by the utter despair aura for 24 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.ob00D61F0c4PIvj1]{Effect: Utter Despair}
39iXJ3VDAsZ4Ij0P.name: Utter Despair

5hi9lEOArhRckj51.description:
This wand features a carved dragon's head at its top and a polished metal sphere set in its midsection.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency Once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} at 7th rank.

After you cast the spell, an additional missile or missiles are released from the wand at the start of each of your turns, as though you cast the 1-action version of magic missile. Choose targets each time. This lasts for 1 minute, until you're no longer wielding the wand, or until you try to activate the wand again.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of magic missile of the appropriate rank.
5hi9lEOArhRckj51.name: Wand of Manifold Missiles (7th-Rank Spell)

6H5o1EKmMK9GLW0X.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.y2cQYLr5mljDSu1G]{Unrelenting Observation}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

To Cast a Spell from a scroll, the spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack roll and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical material components and costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when Casting a Spell from a scroll. You must replace any required material component for that spell with a somatic component. If the spell requires a focus, you must have that focus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.
6H5o1EKmMK9GLW0X.name: Scroll of Unrelenting Observation (Level 8)

7yOLigTAGYofVRkH.description: Dyzallin can deliver insidious mummy rot through any weapons he wields.
7yOLigTAGYofVRkH.name: Channel Rot

8LWkgJLzQH5BuUe3.description:
Dyzallin can use Attack of Opportunity when a creature within his reach uses a concentrate action, in addition to the usual trigger. He can disrupt triggering concentrate actions, and he disrupts actions with a successful attack roll, not just a critical success.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]
8LWkgJLzQH5BuUe3.name: Attack of Opportunity (Special)

KQUnhrJmsbAJPZik.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Quandary}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

To Cast a Spell from a scroll, the spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack roll and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical material components and costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when Casting a Spell from a scroll. You must replace any required material component for that spell with a somatic component. If the spell requires a focus, you must have that focus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.
KQUnhrJmsbAJPZik.name: Scroll of Maze (Level 8)

QMylAxVSUwhm7cSj.description: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.
QMylAxVSUwhm7cSj.name: Dancing Lights

UeNHmJELEMJ1Bs7N.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KqvqNAfGIE5a9wSv]{Heroism}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

To Cast a Spell from a scroll, the spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack roll and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical material components and costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when Casting a Spell from a scroll. You must replace any required material component for that spell with a somatic component. If the spell requires a focus, you must have that focus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.
UeNHmJELEMJ1Bs7N.name: Scroll of Heroism (Level 9)

XB84vRtRawFpT6yg.description:
This disease and damage from it can't be healed until the curse is removed.

A creature killed by this curse turns to sand and can't be resurrected except by a 9th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual or similar magic

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:39]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 @Damage[15d6[void]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 day)
XB84vRtRawFpT6yg.name: Insidious Mummy Rot

ZA4AaC9hSaCxwUee.description:
When Dyzallin is destroyed, necromantic energies rebuild his body inside the mirror in his laboratory over the next [[/br 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}.

His re-forming body is visible in the mirror, but the mirror can't be destroyed while he is re-forming unless a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dbd5W6G8U2vzWolN]{Consecrate} ritual is first cast upon it. Once Dyzallin's rejuvenation is complete, he steps out of the mirror.
ZA4AaC9hSaCxwUee.name: Mirror Rejuvenation

qQOkGagQPycQw5YC.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magical Effects and Vitality Effects

tfSYqUkDGCRtI9KG.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Mental Effects

Dyzallin Shraen.name: Dyzallin Shraen
Dyzallin Shraen.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magical effects and vitality effects, +2 status to all saves vs. mental effects

Dyzallin's Golem.description: Crafted from a nigh-indestructible metal of great rarity, adamantine golems can't be destroyed except by the most powerful foes. Crafting an adamantine golem requires a quantity of adamantine so massive that collecting it usually requires mounting a mining expedition to a distant planet, the Plane of Earth, or an Outer Plane.

4ooKJCagcx7gbeiK.description: The adamantine golem has been built to resemble a bulky drow elf in full plate armor. It is Large in size and its fist Strike has a reach of 10 feet.
4ooKJCagcx7gbeiK.name: Compact

Cb2C8LIPyMVI1r9J.description:
The golem vents a @Template[cone|distance:30] of superheated steam from its internal forge. This deals @Damage[15d6[fire]] damage to all creatures in the cone (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic]).

The golem can't use Vent again for [[/br 1d6 #Recharge Vent]]{1d6 rounds}.
Cb2C8LIPyMVI1r9J.name: Vent

GliiYsgCIg3rdZ5a.description:
The golem can be targeted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ihbRf964JDXztcy3]{Disjunction} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}.

If targeted by such a spell of 9th rank or higher, the golem has its resistance to physical damage lowered to 15 and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} if in repair mode) for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. During this time, if the golem is reduced to 0 HP while already in repair mode, it is destroyed.
GliiYsgCIg3rdZ5a.name: Vulnerable to Dispelling

QIPvgEw3eXLxKT8d.description: The golem repairs itself, regaining [[/r 30[healing]]]{30 Hit Points}.
QIPvgEw3eXLxKT8d.name: Self-Repair

grrGcmbt2tnL36tN.description: On a critical hit, the adamantine golem's fist Strike breaks the target's armor, if any, in addition to dealing damage to the target. If the target has a shield raised, the golem breaks the shield instead.
grrGcmbt2tnL36tN.name: Destructive Strike

sM4ejYbqYSJxrVSd.description:
@Check[fortitude|dc:45|traits:damaging-effect]

Critical Success The creature takes no damage and its armor takes no damage.

Success The golem halts its movement and cannot enter the creature's square.

Failure The resisting creature is damaged and its armor takes damage as if hit by the adamantine golem's fist.

The golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a Fortitude save.
sM4ejYbqYSJxrVSd.name: Inexorable March

t5VxrfWqKM7zBVtb.description:
harmed by acid ([[/r {9d10}]] damage, [[/r {2d10}]] damage from areas or persistent damage); healed by fire (area [[/r 2d10[healing]]] Hit Points); slowed by electricity

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. These exceptions are listed in shortened form in the golem's stat block, with the full rules appearing here. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem.

  • Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.
  • Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.
  • Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's slowed 1 for that round.
  • Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.
t5VxrfWqKM7zBVtb.name: Golem Antimagic

wW41T2Rqe1HsYWiK.description:
When the adamantine golem is at 0 HP, it isn't destroyed. Instead, it enters repair mode, during which it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}, can't take reactions, and can take only the Self-Repair action.

Once it has more than 30 HP, it can use any type of action and can use reactions, though it remains slowed 1 and can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn.

If a critical hit with an adamantine @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6xaxxKfvXED6LfIY]{Vorpal} weapon reduces the golem to 0 HP, or if such a weapon hits it while it's already at 0 HP, then the golem is destroyed.
wW41T2Rqe1HsYWiK.name: Repair Mode

Dyzallin's Golem.name: Dyzallin's Golem

Echoes of Faith.description: The restless spirits of clergy who once inhabited this now-defiled temple of Aroden remain within the sanctuary and pulpit.
Echoes of Faith.hazardDisable: @Check[occultism|dc:26|name:Exorcise the spirits|traits:haunt,hazard] (expert) to exorcise the spirits, or @Check[deception|dc:28|name:Imitate the Arodenite faith|traits:haunt,hazard] or @Check[religion|dc:28] (trained) to imitate the Arodenite faith and render the haunt harmless until it resets
Echoes of Faith.hazardReset: The spirits return in [[/br 1d8 #Hours]]{1d8 hours} as long as any xulgaths remain in Moonstone Hall.
Echoes of Faith.name: Echoes of Faith

1GNw5dkroNexAH5F.description: Inclines and rocky areas are not difficult terrain for an Elysian sheep.
1GNw5dkroNexAH5F.name: Nimble Grazer

6Iz60sgKIQyvGdXg.description: An Elysian sheep gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition whenever it has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition.
6Iz60sgKIQyvGdXg.name: Cowardly

Elysian Sheep.name: Elysian Sheep
Elysian Sheep.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Envenomed Thorns Trap.description: A trip wire strung 4 feet above the ground releases a branch studded with envenomed thorns.
Envenomed Thorns Trap.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Remove Trip Wire] (trained) to remove the trip wire.
Envenomed Thorns Trap.name: Envenomed Thorns Trap

Cgn2V1u3dIaaSjCc.description: Successful Fortitude saves are critical successes instead
Cgn2V1u3dIaaSjCc.name: Successful Fortitude saves are critical successes instead

JBZGDHmgcSKsrjtc.description:
Trigger A creature within Evora's reach uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect Evora makes a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If this attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a move action, she disrupts that action.
JBZGDHmgcSKsrjtc.name: Stand Still

QR5bODSKMiojeESn.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Evora would be reduced to 0 Hit Points but not immediately killed

Effect Evora avoids being knocked out and remains at 1 Hit Point, and her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded} condition increases by 1.
QR5bODSKMiojeESn.name: Orc Ferocity

QhKOuFQANuodhk8x.description:
Requirements Evora is unarmored and touching the ground

Effect Evora enters the stance of an implacable mountain until she is knocked out or the encounter ends. She gains a +4 status bonus to AC and a +2 circumstance bonus to any defenses against being Shoved or Tripped. Her Speed is reduced by 5 feet.
QhKOuFQANuodhk8x.name: Mountain Stance

mXs0X782H3FV7qJD.description:
Effect Evora makes two unarmed Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage and apply resistances and weaknesses only once. She applies her multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.

As it has the flourish trait, Evora can use Flurry of Blows only once per turn.
mXs0X782H3FV7qJD.name: Flurry of Blows

q0Go6gYxsqhxoIiT.description:
Requirements Evora is in Mountain Stance

Effect Evora gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the beginning of her next turn.
q0Go6gYxsqhxoIiT.name: Mountain Stronghold

Evora Yarket.name: Evora Yarket
Evora Yarket.npcAllSaves: successful Fortitude saves are critical successes instead

Explosive Furniture Trap.description: Wiring keeping the furniture together unravels, causing the spring-loaded pieces of furniture and wire to shoot outward.
Explosive Furniture Trap.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:34|name:Identify and Cut Wiring|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to identify and harmlessly cut the taut wiring
Explosive Furniture Trap.name: Explosive Furniture Trap

Faceless Butcher.description: The deformed flesh on this humanoid horror's head bears grim holes where their eyes, nose, mouth, and ears should be, and little else. Stories of faceless butchers always center on the monstrous murderer's preferred weapon: a wicked and bloodstained meat cleaver, which the butcher uses to carve flesh from skull to add to their collection of stolen faces. Once they've taken a victim's face, the faceless butcher can wear it, transform into an exact replica of the deceased, and begin stalking their next victim.

FMub7YCrl8phAqPa.description: The faceless butcher can take on the exact form of any Small, Medium, or Large humanoid whose face they carry in their bag of faces, changing their shape and physical features to precisely match that of the victim whose face they wear. This doesn't change the butcher's Speed or attack or damage bonuses with their Strikes.
FMub7YCrl8phAqPa.name: Change Shape

hrq73xXhTyT182d2.description: When using their Change Shape ability, the faceless butcher loses their alignment aura and thus cannot be detected by spells such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.QnTtGCAvdWRU4spv]{Detect Alignment}.
hrq73xXhTyT182d2.name: Suppressed Alignment

k1jWhjh5eXKkavLa.description:
10 feet. @Check[will|dc:26]

This aura is suppressed if the faceless butcher is using Change Shape.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

ws10H9jL2IqUsARn.description:
Requirements The faceless butcher is undetected by their target

Effect The faceless butcher Strides once and makes two cleaver Strikes against the target. During the Stride, they gain a +10-foot circumstance bonus to their Speed.
ws10H9jL2IqUsARn.name: Sudden Slices

yMe7KsfLbsSFSdYK.description:
Requirements The faceless butcher is within reach of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature

Effect The faceless butcher attempts a cleaver Strike or an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, the faceless butcher deals damage as if they had made a successful cleaver Strike against the creature and removes the creature's face. On a critical success, the damage doubles and the creature takes @Damage[4d6[bleed]]. Once its face is removed, the creature takes a permanent -4 status penalty to Charisma checks and Charisma-based skill checks. This penalty can be removed only if the victim recovers its face from the faceless butcher and has a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SnaLVgxZ9ryUFmUr]{Restoration} spell cast on it.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.NLjzI7gt6djXSoXc]{Effect: Remove Face}
yMe7KsfLbsSFSdYK.name: Remove Face

Faceless Butcher.name: Faceless Butcher

Flea Swarm.description:
Flea swarms roil across city streets and rural hinterlands in a hissing, scraping scrabble, draining blood from any creatures unfortunate enough to cross their path.

Fleas are little more than a nuisance in most circumstances, but can be lethal when they grow to monstrous proportions or gather in enormous swarms.

O3GuY1OWhHhmq9FW.description:
Requirements The flea swarm's last action was Swarming Bites, and it dealt damage to at least one enemy

Effect The flea swarm drinks the creatures' blood. Each victim becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the swarm regains @Damage[3[healing]] HP for each victim drained.
O3GuY1OWhHhmq9FW.name: Suck Blood

ZmpXD5Zs0PQBXPU3.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[(2d4+7)[piercing]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save. A creature that fails its save is exposed to flea fever.
ZmpXD5Zs0PQBXPU3.name: Swarming Bites

coep2DirH6k49uz3.description:
Drain from flea fever can't be reduced or recovered from naturally until the disease is cured.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} ([[/r 1d4]]{1d4 hours})

Stage 2 drained 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and sickened 1 (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} and sickened 1 (1 day)

Stage 5 dead
coep2DirH6k49uz3.name: Flea Fever

Flea Swarm.name: Flea Swarm

Gahlepod.description:
The youngest brughadatches resemble overlarge tadpoles about 2 feet long.

Brughadatches are malevolent fey tricksters with distinct stages of life: they spawn from the First World's primal energies as esurient tadpoles, grow into humanoids capable of creating enticing illusions, then finally evolve into huge, slothful toads that warp their environs with mere thoughts.

jMeQhmA9WidXyyaB.description:
Trigger The gahlepod becomes adjacent to at least one other gahlepod

Frequency once per round

Effect The gahlepod is spurred into a frenzy by the others. For the rest of the round, their jaws Strike deals 1d6 persistent bleed damage in addition to the listed damage.
jMeQhmA9WidXyyaB.name: Churning Frenzy

Gahlepod.name: Gahlepod

Ghost Crystal Cloud.description: The xulgath corpse splits open to release a cloud of tiny ectoplasmic crystals which, when they are inhaled, disorient and devitalize living creatures.
Ghost Crystal Cloud.hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:26|name:Render the cloud inert|traits:hazard,environmental] or @Check[occultism|dc:26|name:Render the cloud inert|traits:hazard,environmental] (expert) to render the crystal cloud inert
Ghost Crystal Cloud.hazardReset: The crystals regrow into a number sufficient to form another dangerous cloud after 1 week.
Ghost Crystal Cloud.name: Ghost Crystal Cloud

Giant Aukashungi.description:
The strongest individual in an aukashungi swarm eventually grows to monstrous proportions.

These massive isopods are native to the Abyssal realm of Gluttondark, in the acidic oceans of the realm's many cavern-worlds. Aukashungis are sometimes summoned to the Material Plane by Zevgavizeb-worshipping cultists, who favor aukashungis for their mindless obedience and sheer destructive potential.

CeucQqSmssZqnYDf.description: When flipped on its back, a giant aukashungi can't move and its soft underbelly becomes exposed. Whenever a creature critically succeeds at a melee attack roll to Strike a giant aukashungi, the attacking creature can forgo the bonus damage to flip over the giant aukashungi (all other critical hit effects apply normally, such as critical specialization effects). While flipped over, the giant aukashungi can't use reactions, can't Stride or Strike, takes a -2 circumstance penalty to AC and saving throws, loses its resistances, and gains weakness 10 to physical damage. The aukashungi can right itself by using the Roll Up activity and then using an action to unroll.
CeucQqSmssZqnYDf.name: Flippable

iCJLRUtX82AUP977.description:
The aukashungi protects its soft underbelly by rolling into a tight ball. The aukashungi gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC while Rolled Up, but it cannot Stride or Strike, and it rolls downhill if on a slope. If the aukashungi is grappling a creature when it Rolls Up, that creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] save or become Swallowed Whole.

The aukashungi can unroll with a single action (this action has the move trait).
iCJLRUtX82AUP977.name: Roll Up

xP1DZ7qExdlGxTkQ.description: The giant aukashungi releases an acidic gas from its ventral glands in a @Template[burst|distance:30]. Each creature that starts its turn in the area takes @Damage[10d8[acid],2d8[persistent,acid]]{10d8 acid damage plus 2d8 persistent acid damage} (@Check[fortitude|dc:32|basic] save). The gas moves 10 feet away from the giant aukashungi each round and lasts for 1 minute. The giant aukashungi can't use Acidic Effluence again for 1 minute.
xP1DZ7qExdlGxTkQ.name: Acidic Effluence

Giant Aukashungi.name: Giant Aukashungi

Giant Flea.description:
Giant fleas are commonly found in areas containing hardy megafauna, such as dinosaurs or mammoths.

Fleas are little more than a nuisance in most circumstances, but can be lethal when they grow to monstrous proportions or gather in enormous swarms.

3AW2a8B425pkI8WL.description:
Drain from flea fever can't be reduced or recovered from naturally until the disease is cured.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} ([[/r 1d4]]{1d4 hours})

Stage 2 drained 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and sickened 1 (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} and sickened 1 (1 day)

Stage 5 dead
3AW2a8B425pkI8WL.name: Flea Fever

ltyVtPkBGAreDacY.description:
Requirements The giant flea's last action was a successful proboscis Strike

Effect The giant flea drinks the creature's blood. The victim becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the flea regains [[/r 5[healing]]]{5 HP}.
ltyVtPkBGAreDacY.name: Suck Blood

Giant Flea.name: Giant Flea

2f1qGs2WLtiERtrf.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:29]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[void]] damage and @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[void]] damage, @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d6[void]] damage; @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage; and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)
2f1qGs2WLtiERtrf.name: Shadow Essence

5JNkXeCqgTEkUhoN.description: Ginjana isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, or flanking creatures of 11th level or lower, or by creatures of 11th level or lower using surprise attack.
5JNkXeCqgTEkUhoN.name: Deny Advantage

7D7K3q9IS7T2K11z.description: Ginjana deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

L0Lzy1bN4NABxIgx.description: When Ginjana rolls a success on a Reflex save, she gets a critical success instead.
L0Lzy1bN4NABxIgx.name: Evasion

VsSnUcSJag9gY3y8.description: Ginjana's movement doesn't trigger reactions when she @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Bcxarzksqt9ezrs6]{Strides} to move half her Speed or less.
VsSnUcSJag9gY3y8.name: Mobility

YM5j7CwSD2jKdyee.description: When Ginjana @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Bcxarzksqt9ezrs6]{Strides} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Steps}, she ignores difficult terrain.
YM5j7CwSD2jKdyee.name: Light Step

aT0ulfinBIPpvzuM.description: When Ginjana critically succeeds at an attack roll, the target of the attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of Ginjana's next turn.
aT0ulfinBIPpvzuM.name: Hampering Blow

jwBiXSOEkYsL5V2p.description:
Trigger An attack roll to Strike Ginjana fails or critically fails

Effect Ginjana redirects the attack to a creature of her choice that is adjacent to her and within reach of the triggering attack. The attacker rerolls the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strike's} attack roll against the new target.
jwBiXSOEkYsL5V2p.name: Sidestep

lFbZsm0qVAkyKv1O.description: Ginjana takes [[/r 20]] damage for every hour she's exposed to sunlight.
lFbZsm0qVAkyKv1O.name: Vulnerable to Sunlight

mfL9ilED2o45HOuI.description: This kit of bandages, herbs, and suturing tools is necessary for Medicine checks to Administer First Aid, Treat Disease, Treat Poison, or Treat Wounds. Expanded healer's tools provide a +1 item bonus to such checks. When you carry the tools from place to place, you keep many of the components handy on your person, in pockets or bandoliers.
mfL9ilED2o45HOuI.name: Healer's Tools (Expanded)

qEzLJPCCAZLBYVV4.description: On the first round of combat, if Ginjana rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to her.
qEzLJPCCAZLBYVV4.name: Surprise Attack

Gluttondark Babau.description: The babau is an assassin, a murderer, and a sadist-certainly not unusual traits, yet their penchant for stealth and surprise sets them apart from their kin. Babaus form from mortal souls of lone killers-those who took pleasure in more personal murders, and particularly those with grisly patterns to their killings.

7XZ5d79YD3f0pWUk.description:
Trigger A creature within the babau's reach successfully hits the babau with a Strike

Effect The babau excretes a gout of acidic, bloodlike slime against the attacker and its weapon. The attacker must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:26|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The attacker avoids the reactive slime.

Success The attacker takes @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage.

Failure The attacker takes @Damage[2d6[acid]] damage.

Critical Failure As failure, except the weapon used to Strike the babau automatically becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken} unless the weapon is made of a material that is immune to acid.
7XZ5d79YD3f0pWUk.name: Reactive Slime

FWCaUjBmQQkZbFfs.description: The babau makes an attack with the intent of creating a particularly horrific and gory wound. It make a melee Strike. This counts as two attacks when calculating their multiple attack penalty. If this Strike hits, the babau deals an additional 1d6 damage and the creature struck is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} for 1 round; this @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} condition cannot be removed by retching.
FWCaUjBmQQkZbFfs.name: Grievous Strike

Tlt7eeLvAwfloiuI.description: A babau deals an additional 1d6 precision damage precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

iKOLPcoDilY7HLdL.description: Babaus revel in the gore of a well-timed attack, and when brutal wounds are restored, they recoil in pain. When a creature heals from damage that the babau dealt on their last turn with Grievous Strike, sneak attack, or a critical hit, the demon takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage. The babau can take this mental damage only once per round.
iKOLPcoDilY7HLdL.name: Mercy Vulnerability

Gluttondark Babau.name: Gluttondark Babau

Guardian of the Faithful.description:
As with any humanoid animated statues of Medium size, giant animated statues are used to guard locations of importance, but their increased size and power make them most useful in large vaults, spacious chambers, or outdoor locations. Animated objects of this strength and size are ideal for tasks and responsibilities usually performed by golems, and more powerful animated objects are thus all but unheard of.

Granted a semblance of life through the use of rituals or other strange magic, animated objects take many forms and serve a variety of uses. A few examples of typical animated objects are listed below. Many of these creatures serve as guardians, surprising unsuspecting adventurers when they suddenly attack. Others serve as idle distractions for the exceptionally rich, simple servants created to handle odd jobs, and the like.

FHYZijWKqxyPWq4b.description: Like normal objects, an giant animated statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an giant animated statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 24.
FHYZijWKqxyPWq4b.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)

M203mlcBNFvAqyIJ.description: The statue grinds a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} into the red-hot coals of its brazier. The target takes @Damage[3d8[fire]] damage and @Damage[1d8[persistent,fire]] damage.
M203mlcBNFvAqyIJ.name: Burn Alive

QlMKYLdaF5xd0vap.description: Each day at dawn, if the guardian has been destroyed, it re-forms in this room. Its maximum Hit Points are permanently reduced by 10, but it is otherwise restored to its full, lower Hit Point total. Once the statue's maximum Hit Points would be 60 or fewer, it can no longer be restored in this manner and is permanently destroyed.
QlMKYLdaF5xd0vap.name: Divine Restoration

v0n7ntTptPAp7TPz.description: The statue carries a wide brazier full of hot coals. To make flaming coal Strikes or use Burn Alive, the statue must have the brazier held in one hand or otherwise have it within reach. Instead of targeting the statue with an attack, a creature can target the brazier directly. The brazier has the same AC and saves as the statue. Dealing 15 cold damage to the brazier or dousing it with at least 2 gallons of water extinguishes the coals. This prevents the statue from using Burn Alive and causes its ranged attacks to no longer deal @Damage[(2d8+2)[fire]] damage.
v0n7ntTptPAp7TPz.name: Brazier

Guardian of the Faithful.name: Guardian of the Faithful

Guthallath Rockslide.description: The rock walls nearby begin to crumble and collapse.
Guthallath Rockslide.hazardDisable: @Check[crafting|dc:48|name:Buttress the Rocks|traits:environmental] (legendary) to buttress the collapsing rocks in three different locations. Using large and durable materials (or applicable spells) to support the rocks reduces the check to @Check[crafting|dc:45|name:Buttress the Rocks|traits:environmental] (master).
Guthallath Rockslide.hazardReset: The guthallath can reset the hazard with a few days of work stacking the fallen rocks.
Guthallath Rockslide.hazardRoutine:
(2 actions) On the hazard's first action, any areas of crumbling rocks from a previous round collapse, making a falling rocks Strike against each creature in the area.

On its second action, the hazard crumbles rocks in a 20-foot radius around the previous collapse. A character can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} (DC 40) to determine where the rocks will fall on the following round, but on a critical failure, they incorrectly identify where the rocks will fall.
Guthallath Rockslide.name: Guthallath Rockslide

Hallowed Wheel.description: An ornate wheel, divided into eight segments with a rune painted on each, is mounted on a pole and controlled by a lever that can be triggered manually or a sensor that detects creatures within 30 feet in front of it.
Hallowed Wheel.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:31|name:Flip the switch|traits:hazard,complex,magical,mechanical,trap] (master) on the wheel to flip the switch returning it to a harmless carnival game, @Check[thievery|dc:26|name:Erase each rune|traits:hazard,complex,magical,mechanical,trap] (expert) to erase each rune, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (5th level; counteract DC 28) to counteract each rune.
Hallowed Wheel.hazardReset: The trap deactivates and resets if 1 minute passes without any creature moving within range of its sensor.
Hallowed Wheel.hazardRoutine:
(2 actions) On its initiative, the trap uses its first action to spin, then stops. Roll [[/r 1d8]]{1d8} to determine which segment is topmost when the wheel stops spinning. The wheel uses its second action to replicate the spell listed for that segment (5th level, DC 27, spell attack roll +17). This spell's target is centered on or otherwise includes the nearest creature in the spell's area. This increases the spell's range to 30 feet if necessary. Any spell cast by this trap is occult.

1 - @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2w4OpAGihn1JSHFD]{Black Tentacles} @Template[burst|distance:20|name:Black Tentacles|traits:hazard,complex,magical,mechanical,trap,conjuration,occult]{20-foot burst} [[/r 1d20+17]]{Spell Attack vs. Target's Fortitude DC}

2 - @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VosLNn2M8S7JH67D]{Blindness} @Check[fortitude|dc:27|name:Blindness|traits:hazard,complex,magical,mechanical,trap,incapacitation,necromancy,occult]

3 - @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LiGbewa9pO0yjbsY]{Confusion} @Check[will|dc:27|name:Confusion|traits:hazard,complex,magical,mechanical,trap,emotion,enchantment,mental,occult]

4 - @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YvXKGlHOt7mdW2jZ]{Death Ward} Range 30 feet

5 - @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse} @Check[will|dc:27|name:Outcast's Curse|traits:hazard,complex,magical,mechanical,trap,curse,enchantment,mental,misfortune,occult] Range 30 feet

6 - @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IqJ9URobmJ9L9UBG]{Shadow Blast} @Template[line|distance:30|traits:hazard,complex,magical,mechanical,trap,evocation,occult,shadow|width:5]{30-foot line} @Check[reflex|dc:27|basic|name:Shadow Blast|traits:hazard,complex,magical,mechanical,trap,evocation,occult,shadow] or @Check[will|dc:27|basic|name:Shadow Blast|traits:hazard,complex,magical,mechanical,trap,evocation,occult,shadow] @Damage[5d8[force]] damage

7 - @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wzLkNU3AAqOSKFPR]{Noise Blast} @Template[burst|distance:10|traits:hazard,complex,magical,mechanical,trap,evocation,occult,sonic]{10-foot burst} @Check[fortitude|dc:27|name:Sound Burst|traits:hazard,complex,magical,mechanical,trap,evocation,occult,sonic] @Damage[2d10[sonic]] damage

8 - @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5KobTMrZeZxuXMgl]{Gecko Grip} Range 30 feet
Hallowed Wheel.name: Hallowed Wheel

Harrow Doll.description: Harrow dolls are unique constructs that can make predictions about the future. The more elite circuses and traveling shows frequently feature a harrow doll, and many use the doll's abilities to learn more about locals to better customize shows to their tastes-or to find easy marks for later cons. Upset patrons that try to harm a harrow doll or reclaim their payment quickly learn that the construct is more than capable of defending itself.

P55ThVkZipK0fIVo.description:
A harrow doll can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury} as part of a harrow reading, which takes the usual 10 minutes.

When casting @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LQzlKbYjZSMFQawP]{Locate}, the harrow doll doesn't need to have previously observed a specific object to learn its direction, but instead can detail the direction only vaguely, using such phrases as "beside a weeping mound" or "beneath the lost sky."

When the harrow doll casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KHnhPHL4x1AQHfbC]{Mind Reading}, there is no effect if the target critically succeeds its save.

Each time a harrow doll makes a harrow reading, it also changes which saving throw is affected by its fortune's favor ability.
P55ThVkZipK0fIVo.name: Uncanny Divination

PQCJPgjYoVwBLXyY.description:
A creature struck by one of the harrow doll's cards must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save or be cursed with misfortune, which forces the creature to roll twice and take the lower result on its next roll of a specific type, determined by the card's suit (roll [[/r 1d6]]{1d6} to randomly determine the suit). A creature can be cursed with only one effect from harrowing misfortune at a time, with a new curse overriding any previous curse. The curse ends after 1 minute or after the specified roll is made, whichever comes first. The suits and their effects are: Hammers (melee attack roll), Keys (Reflex save), Shields (Fortitude save), Books (skill check), Stars (Will save), and Crowns (spell attack roll).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7PYhxmQxCD5kzMlw]{Effect: Harrowing Misfortune}
PQCJPgjYoVwBLXyY.name: Harrowing Misfortune

sMH395MKnCnUaAGg.description:
Whenever the harrow doll attempts a specific type of saving throw, it rolls twice and takes the higher result. The type of saving throw is determined by the suit that featured most prominently in the doll's most recent harrow reading: Fortitude (Hammers or Shields), Reflex (Keys or Books), or Will (Stars or Crowns). If the suit of its latest harrow reading is unknown, roll [[/r 1d6]]{1d6} at the beginning of combat to randomly determine it.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.yQd2Yoht8libCMCv]{Effect: Fortune's Favor}
sMH395MKnCnUaAGg.name: Fortune's Favor

Harrow Doll.name: Harrow Doll

4mA8PLTN8ZFWmcr6.description: The headless xulgath makes up to four claws Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks all count toward the headless xulgath's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the headless xulgath makes all its attacks.
4mA8PLTN8ZFWmcr6.name: Furious Claws

IeoEKCfC28dShDCr.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The headless xulgath has a creature grabbed

Effect The headless xulgath slams the creature against a nearby surface. The creature takes @Damage[(6d6+6)[bludgeoning]] damage and must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:30|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is no longer grabbed.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} for 1 round.
IeoEKCfC28dShDCr.name: Choke Slam

Us6h9h1kYfyx8LCO.description: 30 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:29] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}, and on a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as it is sickened. While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths' stenches for 1 minute.
Us6h9h1kYfyx8LCO.name: Powerful Stench

fofjczD57mSL1xA2.description: The headless xulgath can sense nearby motion through vibrations and air movement
fofjczD57mSL1xA2.name: Motion Sense

MSrCpe3iS4MlI9Or.description:
Frequency once per turn

Requirements Helg's most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip necromancy spell

Effect Helg drains away the life force from a creature targeted by the spell, with a result depending on its Fortitude save (@Check[fortitude|dc:36]). This effect is magical and can be counteracted with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (Level 15, DC 36). This ability cannot affect a creature that critically succeeded at the spell's saving throw, if any.

Critical Success No effect.

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round.

Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

Critical Failure Fatigued, and rest does not remove the creature's fatigued condition for 1 week.
MSrCpe3iS4MlI9Or.name: Enervating Tug

SBbVvzgTVrVDQLcd.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
SBbVvzgTVrVDQLcd.name: Religious Symbol of Bokrug

YRcfAf2JSSaoxUCv.description: Helg makes up to three claw Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks all count toward Helg's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after she makes all her attacks.
YRcfAf2JSSaoxUCv.name: Furious Claws

hgAe4LDV9pOetFnG.description: Despite her size, Helg's multiple joints allow her to fit through tight spaces as if she were a Medium creature. While @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezing}, she can move at her full Speed.
hgAe4LDV9pOetFnG.name: Eerie Flexibility

Herecite of Zevgavizeb.description:
Secreted away in the dark corners of unnamed libraries, necromancer's dens, and heretical scriptoriums, obscure texts describe a horrifying ritual that combines sacrifice and suffering to create a powerful undead being known as a herecite. These monsters, stripped of personal will or desire, are born into the service of an evil god whom they worship unerringly and untiringly, often in spite of any opposing religious leanings they may have had in life. Every herecite harbors an unquenchable self-hatred because it was defiled by such a foul resurrection-a rage it turns outward in an attempt to rob others of their faith and lives.

Herecites often outlast the cults that create them. Stranded herecites are drawn to others of their kind, even if they are dedicated to different evil deities, and when brought together they perform rites to magically bind themselves in a group known as a cabal. While cabal members share enhanced magic and defenses, induction into a cabal appears to hold even deeper significance for herecites. The presence of others of their kind with whom they can pray-in verses warped to venerate wicked gods-seems the only solace these tormented beings can find in undeath. Such a fellowship of sorrow is nigh unbreakable, as many an overzealous crusader has discovered far too late.

Customarily found within heavily modified temples to the pantheon of gods they collectively worship, herecites act in service to their creators or as protectors of unholy ground. High priests of different evil gods may even trade herecites among themselves, allowing their minions to form cabals strengthened by their varied faiths. A lone herecite cut off from its creators-often because it is the sole remnant of a destroyed temple or its master has perished-may wander far and wide in search of a cabal to join. Other times, the herecite seeks out a place sacred to the deity it worshipped in life. Whether motivated by a desire for contrition or vengeance, the end result of this baleful pilgrimage is always the desecration of the holy site and the slaughter of its congregants, who may in turn rise as lesser forms of undead.

HAq5bDyta4z3yz98.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet uses the Sustain a Spell action to sustain a divine spell or the Cast a Spell action to cast a divine spell with a verbal component

Effect The herecite warps the caster's prayers into a sacrilegious echo praising the evils of its own deity. The triggering caster must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:29] saving throw or their spell is disrupted and their action wasted.
HAq5bDyta4z3yz98.name: Perverse Prayer

PQ4Thk0ntFSWU7Gz.description: With murmurs and chants, the herecite casts its consciousness toward the other members of its cabal. For 1 round, it senses what other members are sensing, knows their thoughts, and knows their exact location.
PQ4Thk0ntFSWU7Gz.name: Cabal Communion

iBalLMYNzfQfwcHn.description: A herecite is associated with one evil god and is always of the same alignment as that god. Whenever it wields its deity's favored weapon, that weapon gains the unholy rune. The herecite's creators select two domains from their deity; the herecite can cast the domain spells and the advanced domain spells from those domains as cleric focus spells. The herecite can cast the deity's other granted cleric spells as divine innate spells. Most herecites have 2 Focus Points in their focus pool. The herecite presented here is a herecite of Zevgavizeb.
iBalLMYNzfQfwcHn.name: Herecite Deity

luzb0P0GAIgFEHxS.description: Recalling the cruelty of the foul ritual that birthed it, the herecite curses an enemy with a fragment of its blasphemy. The herecite targets one creature within 30 feet, which must attempt a @Check[will|dc:29] save. On a failure, the creature is cursed. As long as the creature is cursed, any art object, symbol, or implement of religious significance in the creature's possession-such as a divine spellcasting focus, holy text, fetish, or rendering of a deity-becomes physically corrupted in a way that debases the deity's tenets (a depiction of Shelyn's songbird, for example, might lose its beautiful plumage to reveal a hideous skeletal form beneath). While these items continue to function normally, the cursed creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupified 2} as long as it possesses an object corrupted in this fashion. The creature can cast off its corrupted objects to remove the stupefied condition, but any new religious objects it takes into its possession become similarly corrupted. The curse can be lifted by a remove curse spell or by an atone ritual. After a creature is targeted with this ability, regardless of whether it was affected, it becomes immune to herecites' Curse of Defiled Idols for 1 day.
luzb0P0GAIgFEHxS.name: Curse of Defiled Idols

nN899egloBXvGHGV.description:
Requirements The herecite is in a cabal of three or more members, two of which are within 60 feet and have used Cabal Communion within the last round

Effect The herecite casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PHVHBbdHeQRfjLmE]{Spirit Blast}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.MS60WhVifb45qORJ]{Spiritual Epidemic} (DC 31). Once a herecite has used this ability (whether or not it was successful), the cabal must wait 24 hours before one of its members can use Assault the Soul again.
nN899egloBXvGHGV.name: Assault the Soul

oKvWxPQ1VdadXlOL.description: Multiple herecites can form a cabal to gain increased magical abilities and defenses. A cabal consists of two to five herecites. The ritual to form a cabal (or to welcome new herecites into an existing cabal) requires 24 hours of worship, prayer, and vile sacrifice, after which point the herecites become magically bound to one another. All herecites in a cabal gain the cleric domain spells granted by each individual herecite's deity, and each herecite's focus pool increases to 3 Focus Points. As long as the cabal exists, herecites in the cabal gain a +2 status bonus to Perception checks and fast healing 10. These benefits persist as long as the cabal consists of two or more herecites that remain within 1 mile of one another.
oKvWxPQ1VdadXlOL.name: Cabal

teoYBsXeF4ePoNS9.description: Providing the same defensive function as a standard gauntlet, this version has a group of spikes protruding from the knuckles to deliver piercing damage with a punch.

Herecite of Zevgavizeb.name: Herecite of Zevgavizeb

HZ3H7Z76Xxjqqoqw.description: Hollow Hush attempts three claw Strikes, each against a different target within reach. The multiple attack penalty applies to each attack, but increases only after all the attacks have been made.
HZ3H7Z76Xxjqqoqw.name: Rapid Strikes

V4kdJTgqzGT8pdXd.description:
Trigger A creature fails a saving throw to resist one of Hollow Hush's innate spells or emotional focus spells

Effect As Hollow Hush invades the triggering creature's mind and plants the seeds of negative emotions, it also strips away the target's feelings of hope or positivity. Hollow Hush can immediately end a single emotion effect from which the triggering creature is benefiting.
V4kdJTgqzGT8pdXd.name: Spiral of Despair

nWG8oxYnQkgZ85MI.description: Hollow Hush casts up to three spells chosen from its at-will innate spells and its emotional focus spells.
nWG8oxYnQkgZ85MI.name: Emotional Frenzy

omGN70P6v81nFafa.description: Hollow Hush can cast the following cleric domain spells as 9th-rank occult innate spells at will without spending Focus Points: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dj44lViYKvOJ8a53]{Ignite Ambition}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jJphHQlENHFlSElH]{Captivating Adoration}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J8pL8yTshga8QOk8]{Delusional Pride}.
omGN70P6v81nFafa.name: Emotional Focus

yhUioD8pgXFVQiro.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Hollow Hush feeds on the emotional unrest of a single creature within 30 feet that's currently affected by an emotion effect. The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:41|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[5d10[mental]] damage and be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} for 1 round. If the target fails its saving throw, Hollow Hush regains the same number of Hit Points and Feed on Emotion does not cost Hollow Hush an action, allowing it to use another action this turn.
yhUioD8pgXFVQiro.name: Feed on Emotion

0oyBktgze70q4n6D.description: The hooklimb flexes hooklike barbs on its claws. Until the start of the hooklimb's next turn, its claws Strikes deal an additional 1d10 persistent bleed damage.
0oyBktgze70q4n6D.name: Raking Claws

9WtQUWj0NxeFpth4.description: The hooklimb always critically succeeds at checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge}.
9WtQUWj0NxeFpth4.name: Quick Catch

cmJ4It6KgqjEgmOi.description: 30 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}, and on a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as it is sickened. While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths' stenches for 1 minute.
cmJ4It6KgqjEgmOi.name: Powerful Stench

CHFfq14eNMMH7UGa.description: Horba deals an extra 1d8 damage with her tridents, and any trident gains the fatal d10 trait while she is using it (both the extra weapon damage die and the fatal trait have already been included in the trident Strike).
CHFfq14eNMMH7UGa.name: Demonic Strength

D1U3wK3uyoOs5sL1.description:
Horba begins to rage and gains 5 temporary Hit Points. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until she falls unconscious, whichever happens first. While raging, Horba deals 2 additional damage with melee weapons, has a -1 penalty to AC, and cannot use actions that have the concentrate trait unless those actions also have the rage trait. Horba can still @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} while raging.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}
D1U3wK3uyoOs5sL1.name: Tainted Rage

dFgEVCoqXZx2LxVQ.description:
Trigger A foe within Horba's reach attempts to move away from her

Effect Horba keeps pace with the triggering foe. Horba Strides up to her Speed, following that foe and keeping it in reach throughout its movement until it stops moving or Horba has moved their full Speed.
dFgEVCoqXZx2LxVQ.name: No Escape

Host of Spirits.description: A host of angry spirits inhabiting the ruined house attempts to drag living creatures closer and crush them to death.
Host of Spirits.hazardDisable: @Check[religion|dc:43|name:Exorcise Spirits] (master) to exorcise the spirits or @Check[deception|dc:45|name:Trick the Spirits] (master) to trick the spirits into departing
Host of Spirits.hazardReset: The haunt ends 1 round after no creatures are within 50 feet of the house. The haunt resets after 1 day.
Host of Spirits.hazardRoutine: 3 For each of its actions, the trap attempts a ghostly hand Strike against a different creature within 50 feet of the ruins of the house (if there are fewer than 3 creatures, the haunt doesn't use its remaining actions).
Host of Spirits.name: Host of Spirits

Iffdahsil.description: The slithering horror known as Iffdahsil is an undead shoggoth that has haunted the vault of the Black Desert for millennia. Drow legends in particular tend to feature Iffdahsil, terrifying the elves from a young age.

3FngXmc5sXcStz5D.name: +1 Status Bonus to Saves vs. Magical Effects

6ZhIbuBKgvn1KAfr.description:
@Damage[(3d10+17)[piercing]], @Check[fortitude|dc:41|basic]

Note: A DC was not provided for this ability by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature level according to the Gamemastery Guide creature building Tables.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

QHfqtuROQMmVf7uq.description: Unlike most undead, Iffdahsil isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Iffdahsil's fast healing continues to function normally, though on any round it begins its turn at 0 HP, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the start of its next turn. While Iffdahsil is at 0 HP, it can be killed permanently only by simultaneously exposing it to direct sunlight (or a 10th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.a3aQxCpoj1q1NQxC]{Sunburst} spell) and casting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} spell (or similar magic) directed at destroying it.
QHfqtuROQMmVf7uq.name: Unkillable

RtG3Dfe9kEKJnPYX.description:
60 feet. @Check[fortitude|dc:45]

A creature entering or starting its turn in the aura that fails at a Fortitude save becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. If the target was already doomed or drained, the values of these conditions increase by 1, to a maximum of doomed 3 and drained 3. A creature that dies while doomed 3 and drained 3 in this way disintegrates into black sand.
RtG3Dfe9kEKJnPYX.name: Aura of Annihilation

cdxLqOHRZzka3F9n.description: Iffdahsil deals @Damage[8d8[piercing]] damage to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:43|basic] save) and can also attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grab} any creatures who critically fail their save as a free action. Iffdahsil is then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of its next turn.
cdxLqOHRZzka3F9n.name: Tentacular Burst

yVBUPO8bNkZEb4gC.description: A creature that begins its turn inside Iffdahsil takes @Damage[10d6[void]] damage. Iffdahsil gains temporary HP for 1 minute equal to half the damage dealt.
yVBUPO8bNkZEb4gC.name: Eat Away

Iffdahsil.name: Iffdahsil
Iffdahsil.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magical effects

Imperious Darkside Mirror.description: This magic mirror replaces characters with evil duplicates from another dimension.
Imperious Darkside Mirror.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:42|name:Retrieve a Creture from the Mirror|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to retrieve a creature from the mirror within 10 minutes of the switch (possible only if their mirror duplicate is dead), @Check[thievery|dc:47|name:Permanently Disable the Mirror|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to permanently disable the mirror once all mirror duplicates are dead, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 40) to counteract the mirror for 1 minute and prevent additional replacements from appearing during that time.
Imperious Darkside Mirror.hazardReset: The mirror is always ready to absorb creatures into another dimension. 10 minutes after a creature is sucked into the mirror, if an ally doesn't rescue the creature using the Thievery skill, the creature reaches the mirror dimension, where it could be captured or killed. In the mirror dimension, it counts as a mirror duplicate, so the denizens of the other dimension can't destroy the mirror on their side while the absorbed creature is there. These dimensions are alternate realities, not planes, so even rituals like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Interplanar Teleport} can't reach them.
Imperious Darkside Mirror.hazardRoutine:
(1 action) The mirror absorbs another reflected creature into the mirror (@Check[reflex|dc:42]) and replaces it with a mirror duplicate. Mirror duplicates act on their own initiative, using the same statistics as the original creature, but with an evil alignment (changing only abilities that shift with the alignment change).

Mirror duplicates are legendary in Intimidation and are permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}, but they can use this additional action only to Demoralize.

A mirror duplicate can spend 3 actions in contact with the mirror to return to its original dimension and release the creature it duplicated, but most mirror duplicates prefer not to.
Imperious Darkside Mirror.name: Imperious Darkside Mirror

Iridescent Elephant.description: An iridescent animal is a wild or domesticated animal that has undergone a magical transformation to become a luminescent beast that can glow in the dark and use dazzling light-based powers. Although the effect is glamorous, the life of an iridescent animal is a sad one. The change drastically weakens the animal, diminishing both its strength and its vitality. This effect is desirable for some-particularly the circuses, menageries, and royal courts that typically purchase these glowing beasts-but never for the animal itself. Because the effects of the transformation are so deleterious, the act of creating an iridescent animal is strongly frowned upon by druids and other naturalists, some of whom dedicate their lives to rescuing and fostering these maltreated creatures. The procedure cannot be reversed, and few iridescent animals are fit to live in the wild after the transformation, cementing their lot in life to serve as showy beasts of burden or objects of entertainment and ridicule.

An5Bh0snG4EiSy6u.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The iridescent elephant blasts a beam of light from its trunk in a @Template[line|distance:30]. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature is blinded permanently.
An5Bh0snG4EiSy6u.name: Trunk Beam

Gg4EGIEKIMWM6Lln.description: When the iridescent elephant stomps its foot, a bright, disorienting burst of light pulses through its leg. Each creatures adjacent to the iridescent elephant when it makes a foot Strike (regardless of whether or not it hit) must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:24] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of the elephant's next turn.
Gg4EGIEKIMWM6Lln.name: Color Splash

qFVgtcLTXV4LIYQu.description: An iridescent animal emits phosphorescent bright light in a @Template[emanation|distance:15]{15 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}. The animal can suppress this display until the end of its next turn as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. The color of the light is determined by the iridescent animal's creator.
qFVgtcLTXV4LIYQu.name: Glowing Bones

vkLS4esGKnpycmG3.description: A Medium or smaller creature hit by the elephant's trunk is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. If the elephant moves, it can bring the grabbed creature along with it.
vkLS4esGKnpycmG3.name: Grabbing Trunk

Iridescent Elephant.name: Iridescent Elephant

YXTmEPsQrFyF3kDl.description: If Jellico's bowling pin ranged Strike hits, the bowling pin bounces off the target back toward Jellico. Jellico can catch it again if he has a free hand.
YXTmEPsQrFyF3kDl.name: Juggler

g65rOk12pYhMLjoe.description:
Trigger Jellico is the target of a Strike by an attacker he can see

Effect Jellico gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering Strike.
g65rOk12pYhMLjoe.name: Bob and Weave

jGq0rfEKsdYFGYmW.description: Jellico Strides up to his Speed and does not trigger reactions during this movement.
jGq0rfEKsdYFGYmW.name: Bounce-Bounce

RdSrem9D6XcqzAuu.description: The juvenile boar Strides up to two times and then makes a tusk Strike. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.
RdSrem9D6XcqzAuu.name: Boar Charge

Kalkek.description:
Once a barghest has eaten enough to grow into a greater barghest, it typically seeks a method to leave the Material Plane and return to the Abyss, there joining other fiends as yet another of that plane's horrors. As barghests have no innate ability to travel the planes, though, the time it takes for most greater barghests to engineer such a return can usually be measured in years, if not decades. During that time, greater barghests continue to play the roles of gluttons, hunters of humanity, and tyrants of goblinoid tribes. More than a few grow accustomed to such lives on the Material Plane and wholly abandon the end goal of returning to the Abyss, despite the fact that those who do make such a return home often grow even more powerful over time, gaining eerie new abilities and qualities absorbed from the raw chaos of the Abyss itself.

In addition to greater barghests being more powerful than typical barghests, the process of transforming into a greater barghest results in hideous mutations that often grant deadly abilities. Some barghests grow large bat-like wings upon their transformation. Others develop toxic breath or vestigial limbs. The options detailed in the stats below represent only the tip of the proverbial iceberg for barghest mutations-feel free to use these as inspiration for coming up with new mutations of your own design.

YPpyu3mkV5IecFy4.description:
The barghest takes on the shape of a goblinoid (a goblin, hobgoblin, or bugbear) or a wolf, or it transforms back into its true form. When the barghest is a goblinoid, it loses its jaws and claw Strikes, it becomes Small if it is a goblin, and its Speed changes to 20 feet. When the barghest is a wolf, its Speed changes to 40 feet and its jaws gain Knockdown. Each individual barghest has only one goblinoid form and one wolf form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
YPpyu3mkV5IecFy4.name: Change Shape

h0hJAD32OkrXK3lx.description: Kalkek can communicate with lupines and gains a +2 circumstance bonus on Intimidation checks against lupines.
h0hJAD32OkrXK3lx.name: Wolf Empathy

zGEOz9aVguJujbSi.description:
The process of consuming corpses to evolve into a greater barghest results in odd and unpredictable physiological changes. Kalkek has two minor mutations,

Large Grin Gives a powerful, tearing bite.

Wolf Empathy Kalkek has an uncanny empathy with wolves.
zGEOz9aVguJujbSi.name: Mutations

Kalkek.name: Kalkek

D8wFcvl1kfrS8ylG.description:
Trigger Kharostan's turn begins and he has 140 or fewer Hit Points

Effect Kharostan throws caution to the wind to finish the fight. He gains a +2 status bonus to attack rolls, a -2 status penalty to AC, and a -1 status penalty to saves. He can also make a Wicked Bite each time he damages a creature with his jaws Strike, in addition to the usual once per round usage for a free action. These effects last until his rage ends or he has more than 140 Hit Points, whichever comes first.
D8wFcvl1kfrS8ylG.name: Reckless Abandon

GWziNffDvPJKsyJE.description:
Trigger Kharostan damages a creature with a jaws Strike

Frequency once per round

Effect Kharostan's bite leaves the victim's flesh translucent around the site of the injury. He chooses one of the effects below, each of which requires the damaged creature to attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save.

If the jaws Strike was a critical hit, the creature takes both effects, rolling the saving throw once and using the result for both effects.

  • Drain Blood Kharostan drinks some of the victim's blood. On a failed save, the victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}, and Kharostan regains [[/r 20[healing]]]{20 HP} (on a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}, and Kharostan regains [[/r 40[healing]]]{40 HP}).
  • Drain Vitality (necromancy) Kharostan draws out some of the creature's vital essence. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 hour on a failed save (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} for 1 hour on a critical failure).
GWziNffDvPJKsyJE.name: Wicked Bite

TRACG7yjgPCzShSH.description: Kharostan Strides up to five times his Speed in a straight line. He can increase the number of actions for this activity to 3 in order to Stride up to eight times his Speed in a straight line instead.
TRACG7yjgPCzShSH.name: Furious Sprint

Xg6Mx6eG3Oigbdmv.description:
When Kharostan dies, his daemon-tainted flesh quickly rots away and sublimates into a foul-smelling gas that fills a @Template[emanation|distance:10] around his body.

All creatures within the area take @Damage[20d6[void]] damage as their flesh curdles and rots as well (@Check[fortitude|dc:37|basic] save).
Xg6Mx6eG3Oigbdmv.name: Necrotic Decay

fUeuCzXg5rcHjjeb.description:
