Qormintur.name: Qormintur
Qormintur.npcAllSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magical effects

Qurashith.description: Qurashith-or "gluttonwings" in the Common tongue-are fearsome, bat-like predators that haunt the upper reaches of Gluttondark's cavern-worlds. These monstrosities are no mere beasts. A qurashith does not simply devour its victims; once it kills its prey, it physically subsumes the creature into its own body, metabolizing the prey's spiritual essence. Close inspection of a qurashith reveals that its body is an amalgamation of the fiend and its extraplanar and mortal victims, bound together by webs of demonic scar tissue and sticky acidic pus. While the individual personalities of a qurashith's victims gradually metabolize and diffuse into its very substance over time, a particularly charismatic or magically powerful victim might exert some influence over the qurashith's mind for a short time.

C5gcMBexKui4KaYg.description: A creature that takes damage from a qurashith's jaws or spittle must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:39] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure). If a creature is already slowed when it fails its save, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.
C5gcMBexKui4KaYg.name: Paralytic Saliva

FS7b7xFxtknejiPh.description: The qurashith unleashes a debilitating psionic scream. Creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:60] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:35] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. A creature that critically succeeds at its Will save is immune to the qurashith's Psychic Howl for 24 hours. The qurashith can't use Psychic Howl again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Psychic Howl]]{1d4 rounds}.
FS7b7xFxtknejiPh.name: Psychic Howl

pnI5OGCrwAz8IPJ1.description: Any creature that Strikes the qurashith with a melee weapon must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:37] save. On a failure, the creature is disarmed of its weapon, which becomes stuck to the qurashith's body; if the Strike was an unarmed attack, the creature's limb sticks to the qurashith's body and the creature becomes immobilized. A creature must succeed at a @Check[athletics|dc:31|name:Retreive Stuck Weapon] check to retrieve a stuck weapon. On a failure, the creature takes @Damage[2d6[acid]] damage and the weapon remains stuck, and on a critical failure, the creature also becomes stuck to the qurashith and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}. A stuck creature takes @Damage[2d6[acid]] damage each round it remains stuck to the qurashith and can use an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} action to try to free itself from the monster (DC 31).
pnI5OGCrwAz8IPJ1.name: Adhesive Body

Qurashith.name: Qurashith

92xnULMmOwNxGCpN.description: 30 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} for as long as it is sickened; on a critical failure, the creature is instead @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2} for as long as it is sickened. While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to any creature's death stench for 1 minute.
92xnULMmOwNxGCpN.name: Death Stench

RaAxUg8NsJWovO3S.description: When the Raptor Guard wight damages a living creature with a melee Strike, the wight gains 13 temporary Hit Points and the target creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the wight increases the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.
RaAxUg8NsJWovO3S.name: Drain Life

o59thQeI8g01OAvC.description: The Raptor Guard wight's ranged spear Strikes apply drain life, but the wight doesn't gain any temporary Hit Points if the attack hits.
o59thQeI8g01OAvC.name: Hungry Spear

qnz5lB0E15Y5lYDX.description: As long as the Raptor Guard wears its dinosaur-skull helm, its Strikes deal an additional @Damage[1d10[void]] damage, or an additional @Damage[2d10[void]] damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creatures.
qnz5lB0E15Y5lYDX.name: Terror Master

rH50o3UwWDkWRLLK.description: A living humanoid slain by a Raptor Guard wight's melee Strike rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.DBTbqI9QQRtlJwWh]{Wight} after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This wight spawn is under the command of the Raptor Guard that killed it. It doesn't have the drain life or wight spawn abilities and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}. If the creator of the wight spawn dies, the wight spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wight; it regains its free will, gains the drain life and wight spawn abilities, and is no longer clumsy.
rH50o3UwWDkWRLLK.name: Wight Spawn

wCbEGJGbctuI39HT.description:
This terrifying mask is crafted in the visage of a leering demon and grants a +2 item bonus to Intimidation checks.

Activate 2 Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect The mask casts a 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear} spell with a DC of 29.

Raving Spirit.description: The restless spirit of Currew raves against his tormentors when someone enters his room.
Raving Spirit.hazardDisable: @Check[intimidation|dc:30|name:Quiet the spirit|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] (expert) to quiet the spirit for 1 round, or @Check[religion|dc:32|name:Exorcise spirit|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] (master) to exorcise it
Raving Spirit.hazardReset: The haunt grows quiet and resets 1 minute after no creatures are in area B3.
Raving Spirit.hazardRoutine: (2 actions) The haunts casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlcrVRqW1MSKJ5IC]{Phantasmal Killer} (@Check[will|dc:30|name:Phantasmal Killer|traits:hazard,haunt,complex,death,emotion,fear,mental] save and @Check[fortitude|dc:30|name:Phantasmal Killer|traits:hazard,haunt,complex,death,emotion,fear,mental,incapacitation] save for critical failure) on a random creature who can see Currew's bed (it can even target creatures outside of area B3, so long as the target can see the bed). Everyone affected by the phantasmal killer sees the same image: a sickly old man lies in the bed, screaming and ranting about his guilt, shame, and eventual death.
Raving Spirit.name: Raving Spirit

DBng7QU65qzXSOrS.description: The resin-seep xulgath flexes its pores and emits a @Template[line|distance:30] of resin that deals @Damage[3d12[poison]] damage and knocks the target 5 feet back (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save; on a success or critical success the target isn't knocked back, and on a critical failure the target is knocked back 10 feet). The resin-seep xulgath can't use Resin Spray again for [[/br 1d4]]{1d4 rounds}.
DBng7QU65qzXSOrS.name: Resin Spray

Ui0JxPyP262iI9kF.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:28]

Maximum Duration 1 hour

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 minute).

Stage 2 Fatigued and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 minute).

Dev Note: Xulgath Bile is not included on this creature's original stat block except for the ranged dagger strike. We have included it here to allow GMs to choose to use it. It is a copy from Xulgath Bilebearer and the DC has been increased to match this level.
Ui0JxPyP262iI9kF.name: Xulgath Bile

vd0T6m7E9RIQTVJH.description: A creature damaged by a resin-seep xulgath's jaws or claw Strike must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:28|traits:damaging-effect] save or be covered with clumps of noxious resin, taking @Damage[2d8[poison]] damage and a -15-foot penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute (on a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute). The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} for as long it has a Speed penalty. A creature can spend an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact} action to scrape the resin off, decreasing the Speed penalty by 5 with each such action.
vd0T6m7E9RIQTVJH.name: Resin Crust

2oftzl4JLLJIvRRz.description:
Ruanna attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} using Performance rather than Deception. On a success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to any melee attack, not just Ruanna's.

Ruanna then Strides.
2oftzl4JLLJIvRRz.name: Elaborate Feint

BpxtMRqCWF0AjSbe.description:
Despite covering the entire face, this alabaster mask does not hinder vision or other senses. Wearing the mask grants a +1 item bonus to Performance checks while acting, orating, performing comedy, or singing.

Activate A envision

Effect You change the mask's appearance into an artistic rendition of a dramatic character of your choice.

Runkrunk.description:
Traditionally, clay golems are crafted in the image of a deity and used as guardians of tombs or sacred crypts. Clay golems have the power to lay curses upon their victims as punishment for intrusion, leading many to believe that these oft-ancient constructs have a touch of the divine to them. While this idea has little basis in reality, superstitious folk still tread lightly around statues that resemble clay golems even in the slightest.

The animating force within a clay golem is unusually unstable, making the golem prone to entering a berserk frenzy when damaged. Entire treasuries have been totally ruined as a result of a rampaging clay golem, so crafters do well to make sure their golems are maintained and in good working order-or otherwise place them on the other side of the door from the treasures they wish to protect.

MTJ6P2pU1320fO7f.description: A severely damaged clay golem has a chance of going berserk. If it has 50 or fewer Hit Points at the start of its turn, the golem must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] check or go berserk. A berserk golem wildly attacks the nearest living creature, or the nearest object if no creatures are nearby.
MTJ6P2pU1320fO7f.name: Berserk

g2OkSiICf1gw8aes.description:
Frequency Once per day.

Trigger The clay golem's turn begins. It can't trigger this free action on the first turn of combat.

Effect The clay golem becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 minute.
g2OkSiICf1gw8aes.name: Quicken

gQ7hVeDi4X11cJlc.description: A creature hit by the clay golem's fist must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:29] save or be cursed until healed to its maximum HP. The cursed creature can't regain HP except via magic, and anyone @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Casting a Spell} to heal the creature must succeed at a DC 29 counteract check or the healing has no effect. The golem's counteract rank is equal to its creature level.
gQ7hVeDi4X11cJlc.name: Cursed Wound

lB6Yf4JEFM6O42nb.description: Runkrunk has an Intelligence modifier of -2, a Nature skill of +16, and knows Common and Dwarven (but can't speak any language).
lB6Yf4JEFM6O42nb.name: Awakened

mdOM5OxBjVA6iPqa.description:
• Harmed By cold and water (@Damage[5d10[untyped]] damage, @Damage[2d6[untyped]] damage from areas or persistent damage)
  • Healed By acid (area @Damage[2d6[healing]] Hit Points)
  • Slowed By earth

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. These exceptions are listed in shortened form in the golem's stat block, with the full rules appearing here. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem.

  • Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.
  • Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.
  • Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's slowed 1 for that round.
  • Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.
mdOM5OxBjVA6iPqa.name: Golem Antimagic

xOGJ7uK7SF5xcrH2.description: A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate} spell affects the golem but deals half the normal amount of damage and causes the golem to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round.
xOGJ7uK7SF5xcrH2.name: Vulnerable to Disintegrate

zNcTKoBJlpFDMTec.description:
Requirements The golem is berserk.

Effect The clay golem Strikes with its fist at a -1 circumstance penalty. If it hits, it deals an additional @Damage[1d8[bludgeoning]] damage and knocks the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
zNcTKoBJlpFDMTec.name: Berserk Slam

Runkrunk.name: Runkrunk

34SnogKLGJ3qYmNi.description:
At the start of Sarvel's turn, if he is dead, unconscious, or otherwise unable to act, his efforts in the unfinished extinction curse ritual pull on the power of an aeon orb.

The surge of power heals his body completely without causing the wounded condition, causes him to grow an additional tentacle, and attempts to counteract all detrimental effects on Sarvel as a 10th-rank effect with a [[/r 1d20+42 #Counteract]]{+42 counteract modifier}.

An aeon orb used by Sarvel or the heroes is depleted and can't be used to power this ability.
34SnogKLGJ3qYmNi.name: Echoes of Aeons

KczcQ2zt8BqH8GXB.description:
30 feet. A creature that enters or begins their turn in the emanation must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:45] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round; on a critical failure, it can't target Sarvel with any Strikes or other effects from its confused condition.

While within the emanation, the creature takes a -2 penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition.

A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths' stenches for 1 minute. Sarvel can suppress or resume this aura as a free action.
KczcQ2zt8BqH8GXB.name: Enraging Stench

WdgZS5lTwdxmxcS7.description: Providing the same defensive function as a standard gauntlet, this version has a group of spikes protruding from the knuckles to deliver piercing damage with a punch.

boMBR55PMuMTWR4T.description:
Sarvel begins combat with two tentacles. Each tentacle has 66 HP and is immune to area damage.

A creature can attempt to sever one of Sarvel's tentacles by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the tentacle's Hit Points. A tentacle not completely severed returns to full HP at the end of any creature's turn.

For each tentacle he has, Sarvel gains an extra reaction at the start of his turn that can be used only for an Attack of Opportunity. If he has no tentacles, he can no longer make tentacle Strikes, Writhe Independently, or Constrict.
boMBR55PMuMTWR4T.name: Touch of Zevgavizeb

mK3VIhZzqlLlHNtN.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Sarvel makes one tentacle Strike with each tentacle he currently has (to a maximum of six Strikes), but he can't target a single creature with more than one Strike. Each attack counts toward his multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until all the attacks have been made.
mK3VIhZzqlLlHNtN.name: Writhe Independently

Saurian Warmonger.description:
These saurians adopt warfare as their primary role and greatest calling. They particularly excel at taking slaves.

Enormous tyrannosaurus-humanoids, saurians are ancient beings who predate the rise of humans and dwell in the world's primeval jungles. While the saurians presented here are evil, saurians of all alignments exist.

1Rnw0tm3ktKN04Sv.description: A warmonger wields their mancatcher in one hand.
1Rnw0tm3ktKN04Sv.name: Primordial Balance

XKYMPRy9Hv28Tbkk.description:
The saurian warmonger makes three Strikes: one Strike each with the weapons in their hands and one Strike with their tail. They can perform these attacks in any order, though each counts toward their multiple attack penalty as normal.

After making a Three-Limbed Lunge, the warmonger is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of their next turn.
XKYMPRy9Hv28Tbkk.name: Three-Limbed Lunge

bNJHQZLJcksGVWsc.description:
The saurian warmonger bellows, evoking the power of the primordial world.

Non-dinosaur creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} take @Damage[10d6[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:34|basic] save). On a failed save, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} [[/r 1d4 #Stunned Value]]{1d4} on a critical failure).

The saurian can't use Boneshaking Roar again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Boneshaking Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.
bNJHQZLJcksGVWsc.name: Boneshaking Roar

jsL5jhGaz2pctkeU.description:
When the warmonger makes a successful mancatcher Strike, their target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:34] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} until the end of the warmonger's next turn.

Each time the creature fails an attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} the warmonger, it takes @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage.
jsL5jhGaz2pctkeU.name: Restrain

Saurian Warmonger.name: Saurian Warmonger

Saurian Worldwatcher.description:
The longest-lived saurians favor introspection and take the long view of things-though this thoughtfulness should not be mistaken for weakness. Other saurians defer to worldwatchers' experience.

Enormous tyrannosaurus-humanoids, saurians are ancient beings who predate the rise of humans and dwell in the world's primeval jungles. While the saurians presented here are evil, saurians of all alignments exist.

5utWutqAL3Pfpee3.description: Whenever the worldwatcher hits a creature with their fist or naginata Strike, that creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:39] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical hit).
5utWutqAL3Pfpee3.name: Stunning Blow

GJq1pfArAB262GZd.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger A creature makes a melee Strike against the worldwatcher but misses

Effect The worldwatcher breaks the triggering creature's limb or weapon. If the triggering Strike was an unarmed attack, the triggering creature takes @Damage[6d6[bludgeoning]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the limb is reset (an Interact action with the manipulate trait). If the triggering Strike was a weapon Strike, the weapon takes @Damage[6d6[bludgeoning]] damage.
GJq1pfArAB262GZd.name: Raptor Jaw Disarm

pPAfuiRx3hQmyGuJ.description:
The saurian worldwatcher bellows, evoking the power of the primordial world.

Non-dinosaur creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} take @Damage[10d6[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:38|basic] save). On a failed save, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} [[/r 1d4 #Stunned Value]]{1d4} on a critical failure).

The saurian can't use Boneshaking Roar again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Boneshaking Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.
pPAfuiRx3hQmyGuJ.name: Boneshaking Roar

Saurian Worldwatcher.name: Saurian Worldwatcher

Shanchek.description: Xulgath thoughtmaws are inheritors of the xulgaths' ancient psychic legacy. They eagerly and liberally use their ability to extract knowledge from their foes to quicken their own prodigious intellects.

1329nZKSKvV6X654.description:
The thoughtmaw invades the mind of a creature within 100 feet and attempts to swallow its capacity for higher thought. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save.

Using Consume Knowledge immediately ends any of the ability's previous effects on a different creature.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is slowed 1 and can take no actions other than basic actions for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, and the thoughtmaw is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1} for 1 minute. It can use this extra action to Stride, Strike, or Cast a Spell if the target had prepared spells or a spell repertoire.
1329nZKSKvV6X654.name: Consume Knowledge

uaFGybzZAhGxxd3L.description:
30 feet. A creature that enters the emanation must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save.

On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round on a critical failure).

A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to psychogenic secretions for 1 minute.
uaFGybzZAhGxxd3L.name: Psychogenic Secretions

Shanchek.name: Shanchek

Shoony Hierarch.description: For all their advancement in agriculture, horticulture, and animal husbandry, shoonies subscribe to a remarkably antiquated form of leadership; the role of hierarch is normally inherited, passed on to the oldest living child of the village's previous hierarch. In the instance that the village's hierarch does not produce an heir, the village holds a general election. Elected hierarchs hold the term for life and are just as highly regarded as hierarchs raised from birth. When the settlement comes under attack, it is up to the hierarch to decide when to fight and when to flee. In most cases, shoonies prefer to elect individuals with a preference toward the latter.

UE6Gaj3IfXSpVJue.description: The shoony hierarch sparks and launches an alchemically treated arrow that creates a bright light high in the sky. A signal arrow cannot be used to deal damage. Hierarchs carry a number of different arrows that signal different things; a red signal arrow might mean retreat, whereas a green arrow might be a call to gather in the village commons.
UE6Gaj3IfXSpVJue.name: Signal Arrow

VojkR50T97lhGAno.description: The Shoony Hierarch's blunt snout and labyrinthine sinus system make it resistant to phenomena that assail the nose. When it rolls a saving throw against inhaled threats (such as inhaled poisons) and olfactory effects (such as xulgath stench), the outcome is one degree of success better than the result of its roll.
VojkR50T97lhGAno.name: Blunt Snout

WC2Jedgc1MI3i61x.description: You hail from shoonies who have lived long and successfully among the reeds and cattails of swamps and marshes, and have adapted to the challenges of living near waterlogged ares. You ignore difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from bogs. When you roll a success to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swim}, you get a critical success instead.
WC2Jedgc1MI3i61x.name: Paddler Shoony

Shoony Hierarch.name: Shoony Hierarch

Shoony Militia Member.description: If shoonies had their way, war would cease to exist altogether, but they know this isn't likely. Shoonies' relative wealth of resources and their frailty compared to other humanoids make them a common target of violence and subjugation. Because of this, basic combat training is typically mandatory for all shoony village members. Few individuals pursue lifelong careers in service to their settlement's militia, however. The passing down of a sword from one shoony soldier to another is a time-honored tradition, owing to the rarity of weapons in shoony society.

Ekh1nBGghfmd4C6b.description: The Shoony Militia Member's blunt snout and labyrinthine sinus system make it resistant to phenomena that assail the nose. When it rolls a saving throw against inhaled threats (such as inhaled poisons) and olfactory effects (such as xulgath stench), the outcome is one degree of success better than the result of its roll.
Ekh1nBGghfmd4C6b.name: Blunt Snout

XFsCgh1lNBVEVHzo.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

Shoony Militia Member.name: Shoony Militia Member

Shoony Tiller.description:
Nearly all shoonies in a given settlement are farmers, fishers, or foragers. Shoonies are not expected to fight to protect their settlements; most agree it is better to live in cowardice than to die with that foolish, intangible principle taller races call "honor." Many shoonies hone their skill with tools rather than arms in the knowledge that whatever is lost to violence can be rebuilt. When cornered, a shoony may put up a fight with whatever they have on hand; the average shoony can wield a simple shovel or pick in melee as well as most humans can wield a sword.

Shoonies are reclusive humanoids who resemble bipedal dogs with wrinkled faces and bulging eyes. They predominantly dwell in the grasslands and hilly plains of the Isle of Kortos. Shoony societies on Kortos are known for their agricultural prowess, industrious work ethic, and skill with tools to shape their environment.

Shoonies have a rich oral history and claim that their kind flourished all around Kortos in the days when the living god Aroden walked among them. Many shoonies believe that Aroden himself personally created the shoonies after he raised the island from the bottom of the sea, and that he had a deep affinity for their people. Whether or not such tales of companionship with the god of humanity are true, shoonies have drastically declined in numbers since Aroden's death over a hundred years ago. Shoony elders point to strange environmental phenomena around their island home as one cause of their diminishment, and others attribute their decline to the rise of warmongering monsters in the area. In a world where might often makes right, it is hardly a surprise that the peaceful but timid shoonies are becoming increasingly rare.

aCZG1swHw2Dy22DT.description: The Shoony Tiller's blunt snout and labyrinthine sinus system make it resistant to phenomena that assail the nose. When it rolls a saving throw against inhaled threats (such as inhaled poisons) and olfactory effects (such as xulgath stench), the outcome is one degree of success better than the result of its roll.
aCZG1swHw2Dy22DT.name: Blunt Snout

n0wujzukuAjn0imB.description:
Requirements You are standing on dirt, sand, snow, or similar particulate material.

Effect Your hands work as effectively as shovels when you need to dig a quick hole. You dig a shallow pit in the square you currently occupy, turning the square into difficult terrain (including for you). In addition, you also kick up a cloud of grit in a direction of your choice. The cloud extinguishes small, unattended, non-magical fires and helps smother the flames on burning creatures located within the cone; creatures in this cone that are taking @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage} can immediately attempt an additional @Check[flat|dc:15] to end the persistent damage.
n0wujzukuAjn0imB.name: Dig Quickly

Shoony Tiller.name: Shoony Tiller

0CogrGS0ASUBnsef.description: 30 feet. When a creature in the aura uses a vitality spell or ability, the graveknight automatically attempts to counteract it, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+24 #Counteract]]{+24}.
0CogrGS0ASUBnsef.name: Sacrilegious Aura

1mjGXpAe5x8aw8Vm.description:
Venom from enormous purple worms leaves a victim weakened.

Activate 2 Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:32]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)
1mjGXpAe5x8aw8Vm.name: Purple Worm Venom

2Om4RqsiR8arN4hn.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour.

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:36] save

Onset 1 hour

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, the creature's Speed is reduced by 10, and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.6rnB7nK6J6zF4vea]{Effect: Graveknight's Curse}
2Om4RqsiR8arN4hn.name: Graveknight's Curse

BeWl7Ot39HAvDQoK.description:
+1 status bonus to all saves vs. magic effects.

+2 status bonus to all saves vs. mental effects.
BeWl7Ot39HAvDQoK.name: Status Bonus to Saves

DGdr4bFy6st5SYhQ.description: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.
DGdr4bFy6st5SYhQ.name: Dancing Lights

DgPlSSqql6BVhbUO.description: The Shraen graveknight draws a weapon, then Strikes with it.
DgPlSSqql6BVhbUO.name: Quick Draw

aBnc125GEiD84WGM.description:
At the time of its creation, a graveknight chooses one of the following energy types that was relevant to its life or death: acid, cold, electricity, or fire.

Any weapon the graveknight wields gains the effects of the caustic, frost, shock, or flaming weapon rune, respectively, in addition to a +1 striking weapon rune.

If the graveknight is 14th level or higher, its weapons instead gain the effects of the greater versions of both of these runes.
aBnc125GEiD84WGM.name: Ruinous Weapons

lFWZDfozTLjw9c8x.description: The Shraen graveknight Steps once then Strikes with its rapier. A creature damaged by the attack must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:36|traits:damaging-effect] save. On a failure, the creature takes @Damage[4d6[bleed]]. On a critical failure, the attack pierces the creature's heart, and the creature dies.
lFWZDfozTLjw9c8x.name: Heart-Seeking Strike

tdl0fojnWCseyME0.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/br 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Forge of Creation, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.
tdl0fojnWCseyME0.name: Rejuvenation

yyIFnrfdqZb4Oqeh.description:
The graveknight unleashes a @Template[cone|distance:30] of energy. Creatures in the area take @Damage[8d12[cold]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic] save).

The graveknight can use this ability once every [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4 rounds}.
yyIFnrfdqZb4Oqeh.name: Devastating Blast

Shraen Graveknight.name: Shraen Graveknight
Shraen Graveknight.npcAllSaves: +1 status bonus to all saves vs. magic effects, +2 status bonus to all saves vs. mental effects

I8280Iq9dO7AtDc4.description:
A creature can't recover from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} condition until Abyssal plague is cured

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:33]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 drained increases by 2 (1 day)
I8280Iq9dO7AtDc4.name: Abyssal Plague

PTFpKWM9gdLACL3N.description:
Skarja adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r784cIz17eWujtQj]{Scrying}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8Umt1AzYfFbC4fui]{Spellwrack} to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

UOVIQWXoyaOc2IBj.description: When Skarja rides a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.qRUqoezeEnQ2KdyT]{Nightmare}, the nightmare also gains her status bonus to saves against magic, and both the hag and rider benefit when Skarja uses her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Jp9K5Q9t9ZiDGSaI]{Heartstone's} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D2nPKbIS67m9199U]{Ethereal Jaunt} innate spell.
UOVIQWXoyaOc2IBj.name: Nightmare Rider

UwmfxnwjIDn1MR7C.name: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

Y7eL4NGth0AzOHCF.description: Skarja can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack or damage bonuses with her Strikes, but might change the damage type her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strikes} deal (typically to bludgeoning).
Y7eL4NGth0AzOHCF.name: Change Shape

YOtRTnyprnEC769l.description: A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the night hag takes a -2 circumstance penalty to checks and DCs to defend against her spells.
YOtRTnyprnEC769l.name: Spell Ambush

YRWhIzukE4zO9fUH.name: -2 to All Saves (If Hearstone is Lost)

tW1DUMQeCYYiJFWi.description:
If Skarja is ethereal and hovering over a sleeping chaotic or evil creature, she can ride the victim's back until dawn. The creature endures tormenting dreams as Skarja casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} on it, and is exposed to Abyssal Plague.

Any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} condition caused by dream haunting is cumulative. Only an ethereal being can confront the night hag and stop her dream haunting.
tW1DUMQeCYYiJFWi.name: Dream Haunting

Skarja.name: Skarja
Skarja.npcAllSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic, -2 to all saves if Skarja doesn't have her heartstone

Smiler.description:
Ghasts-feral, foul-smelling, and constantly hungry-are the more powerful kin of ghouls. They are relentless in the pursuit of their prey.

Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

AUdWGOamBXZXat3B.description:
Requirements Smiler is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect Smiler devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[3d6[healing]] Hit Points.

He can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.
AUdWGOamBXZXat3B.name: Consume Flesh

GCpCG2QeVwHXzzqM.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.VC7rtYR4hLxwg7WZ]{Ghast} the next midnight
GCpCG2QeVwHXzzqM.name: Ghast Fever

ce0ME84C2cbPH0JA.description: Any living creature hit by Smiler's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.
ce0ME84C2cbPH0JA.name: Paralysis

k1Ehx0dobB1JSYjA.description: Smiler jumps up to half his Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.
k1Ehx0dobB1JSYjA.name: Swift Leap

xdZGT2FQbkaAnnVv.description:
10 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Ghast Stench}
xdZGT2FQbkaAnnVv.name: Stench

Smiler.name: Smiler

URItNOOpBctKvf7C.description: The smoldering leopard Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the leopard began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after making this ability's Strike.
URItNOOpBctKvf7C.name: Pounce

WLQETe40LtIHyPGa.description: The smoldering leopard deals an extra 1d4 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

kBizs5Rm1STeq41l.description: 10 feet. Every creature within the aura is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}; smoldering leopards can see through this concealment.
kBizs5Rm1STeq41l.name: Aura of Smoke

tkLePiTdXXB3VbWz.description: The smoldering leopard makes two claw Strikes against a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. A creature hit by both claw Strikes also takes @Damage[1d4[persistent,fire]] damage. Both attacks count toward its multiple attack penalty, but the penalty increases only after both attacks are made.
tkLePiTdXXB3VbWz.name: Scorching Maul

4hmSKla48vJAAJG6.description: When a sodden sentinel is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it explodes, dealing @Damage[6d6[bludgeoning]] damage to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save). A creature that fails this save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} (1 minute on a critical failure).
4hmSKla48vJAAJG6.name: Tainted Guts

DrJdeATQTR9zK1Rn.description: A sodden sentinel's fist Strike deals an additional 2d6 damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} creatures.
DrJdeATQTR9zK1Rn.name: Pummel the Fallen

nNzZIeP9wu8KlZFp.description: The sodden sentinel vomits up a supernaturally tainted wave of seawater in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Each living creature in the area takes @Damage[6d10[void]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save). It can't use Seawater Retch again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Seawater Retch]]{1d4 rounds}.
nNzZIeP9wu8KlZFp.name: Seawater Retch

zDrqxe9jDHILx6v0.description: A sodden sentinel is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
zDrqxe9jDHILx6v0.name: Slow

Spiked Barricade Trap.description: Spring-loaded wedges of sharpened stone pop out of the wooden barricade.
Spiked Barricade Trap.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:33|name:Supress Spring Mechanism|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to suppress the spring mechanism for one 5-foot segment of the barricade
Spiked Barricade Trap.hazardReset: The trap must be manually reset by pushing the wedges back into place.
Spiked Barricade Trap.name: Spiked Barricade Trap

Stabbing Sentinel.description: A petrified creature momentarily animates to attack an adjacent creature.
Stabbing Sentinel.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:40|name:Remove Animating Magic|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to remove the animating magic without triggering the trap, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 38) to counteract the animating magic
Stabbing Sentinel.hazardReset: The magical energy that animates the statue builds up again over 24 hours and the trap resets.
Stabbing Sentinel.name: Stabbing Sentinel

rNe7hr19TVEKyp1e.description: 60 feet. Any creature that ends its turn in the aura feels the intense pain of starvation and must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save. On a failure, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} and takes [[/r 7d6]]{7d6 damage}. Damage and fatigue a creature takes from this aura can't be healed until the affected creature has eaten a full meal.
rNe7hr19TVEKyp1e.name: Starvation Aura

tk1qMQuv7snMkpnc.description:
The gashadokuro breathes a spray of bone shards in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Each creature in the area takes @Damage[9d12[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic] save).

It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.
tk1qMQuv7snMkpnc.name: Breath Weapon

vhSzb4rXivmMx69j.description: If the gashadokuro kills a creature with Swallow Whole, it immediately regains Hit Points equal to the swallowed creature's level. As long as the gashadokuro still exists, creatures consumed in this way can't be resurrected except by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} or a similarly powerful effect.
vhSzb4rXivmMx69j.name: Corpse Consumption

6coOtGICrhXGQ5MW.description: If a would disrupt Stirvyn's spellcasting action, he attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15] check. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.
6coOtGICrhXGQ5MW.name: Steady Spellcasting

9siPff9BhSHUe2TK.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8ViwItUgwT4lOvvb]{False Vitality}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

To Cast a Spell from a scroll, the spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack roll and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical material components and costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when Casting a Spell from a scroll. You must replace any required material component for that spell with a somatic component. If the spell requires a focus, you must have that focus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.
9siPff9BhSHUe2TK.name: Scroll of False Life (Level 2)

DJwAey2Keob2rJ2y.description: When Stirvyn Casts a Spell from a spell slot, if the spell deals damage and doesn't have a duration, he gains a status bonus to that spell's damage equal to the spell's rank.
DJwAey2Keob2rJ2y.name: Dangerous Sorcery

R9xjpMLRExdAfpdw.description:
Trigger Stirvyn is targeted with an attack and is adjacent to an ally

Effect Stirvyn and the ally swap places, and the ally becomes the target of the attack.
R9xjpMLRExdAfpdw.name: Duck Away

eF1NPrH42zK6nWtF.description:
When Stirvyn casts a bloodline spell, a surge of ancestral memories grants either him or a target of the spell a +1 status bonus to skill checks for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.EqdXFH2l0TyeOTQz]{Effect: Bloodline Magic (Stirvyn Banyan)}
eF1NPrH42zK6nWtF.name: Bloodline Magic

iK01xznghuNo1ggg.description:
This polished wooden staff bears a swirling motif reminiscent of the folds of a brain. While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify mental magic.

Activate Cast a Spell

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

  • Cantrip @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4gBIw4IDrSfFHik4]{Daze}
  • 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D442XMADp01qJ7Cs]{Mindlink} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R8bqnYiThB6MYTxD]{Phantom Pain}
  • 2nd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Mkbq9xlAUxHUHyR2]{Paranoia}
  • 3rd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ZYoC630tNGutgbE0]{Hypercognition} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R8bqnYiThB6MYTxD]{Phantom Pain}
  • 4th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.FhOaQDTSnsY7tiam]{Rewrite Memory} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HqTI6wRrck1YXp3F]{Telepathy}
  • 5th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R8bqnYiThB6MYTxD]{Phantom Pain} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.BilnTGuXrof9Dt9D]{Synaptic Pulse} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OAt2ZEns1gIOCgrn]{Synesthesia}

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

idbSmKz24v98oQhN.description:
Maps are uncommon. Most maps you can find are simple and functional. A survey map details a single location in excellent detail.

One of these maps gives you a +1 item bonus to Survival checks and any skill checks to Recall Knowledge, provided the checks are related to the location detailed on the map.

The GM determines what maps are available in any location.
idbSmKz24v98oQhN.name: Sheriff Banyan's Map of the Sea Caves

Suffering Xulgaths.description: The shadows of four xulgaths endlessly relive their deaths at the hands of the wendigos and their clutchmates.
Suffering Xulgaths.hazardDisable: @Check[religion|dc:42|name:Calm a Spirit|traits:haunt] (master) or @Check[occultism|dc:42|name:Calm a Spirit|traits:haunt] (master) to calm each of the four spirits. On a character's first successful check, the character also learns that xulgath funerary rites typically involve cremation, which hints that fire is a viable way to put them to rest.
Suffering Xulgaths.hazardReset: The haunt is deactivated and resets 1 minute after all non-wendigo creatures leave the area.
Suffering Xulgaths.hazardRoutine: (4 actions) Each active spirit chooses a living non-wendigo creature within 120 feet and attempts to devour it, targeting different creatures if possible. Each calmed spirit reduces the hazard's actions by 1
Suffering Xulgaths.name: Suffering Xulgaths

2dsQhpuTqRGQXQLq.description: The delinquent draws a weapon with an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact} action, then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strikes} with the weapon they just drew.
2dsQhpuTqRGQXQLq.name: Quick Draw

8loSKEMWA19UGKNG.description: When Forcing Open an object that doesn't have an easy grip, a crowbar makes it easier to gain the necessary leverage. Without a crowbar, prying something open takes a -2 item penalty to the Athletics check to Force Open (similar to using a shoddy item).

E2UQQSW7N3ZLX51N.description: The delinquent deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

lMFrsrHGqi1hl36L.description: Creatures the delinquent critically hits are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and can't make reactions until the end of the delinquent's next turn.
lMFrsrHGqi1hl36L.name: Rattling Blow

pPirfuGfRrPRUV8Y.description:
Trigger The delinquent is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker she can see.

Effect The delinquent gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

wgAgCBHThMqRAxPI.name: A Brush and Pot of Red Paint

Tallow Ooze.description:
Pale yellow and smelling of meat, this unnatural, globular monster is composed entirely of rendered animal fat. A tallow ooze typically results from magical mishaps during the creation of enchanted candles or soaps, or while rendering the fat of a magical beast, though occasionally spellcasters create these beings intentionally.

A tallow ooze hunts other creatures to subsume them into its own body and absorb their fat. Since tallow is solid at room temperature, tallow oozes must metabolize their own bodies to produce enough heat to remain gelatinous. A tallow ooze that cannot replenish itself with absorbed fat will either consume itself or solidify, though a tallow ooze exposed to too much heat might melt entirely.

6T41uBvYSdsd3etb.description:
Whenever the tallow ooze takes fire damage, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round (it can only Stride or Strike with the extra action).

Whenever the tallow ooze is dealt cold damage (even if that damage is prevented by its resistance), it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round and can't use its Engulf ability (but creatures already engulfed are still engulfed).
6T41uBvYSdsd3etb.name: Congealed

JW7pj6pjhMG4D95l.description: When the tallow ooze critically succeeds at an attack against a creature or a creature escapes from being engulfed by the ooze, that creature's hands and gear become slick with grease. For [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, the affected creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:30] save whenever it uses any item (including weapons) that must be wielded or held. On a failure, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to any attack roll or check to use the item; on a critical failure, the creature drops the item, which lands in a random adjacent square. The creature (or an adjacent ally) can use 1 Interact action to wipe off the grease from an item or from its hands.
JW7pj6pjhMG4D95l.name: Residual Grease

dCh3xhDcX6ef0gtU.description: 10 feet. Any creature that starts its turn in or enters a square in the area must attempt a @Check[acrobatics|dc:30|traits:aura,action:balance] check to Balance. A creature that takes a Step doesn't need to roll this check.
dCh3xhDcX6ef0gtU.name: Greasy Seepage

o204NA9EFmplkmbF.description: A tallow ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.
o204NA9EFmplkmbF.name: Motion Sense (60 feet)

Tallow Ooze.name: Tallow Ooze

1d1wn0NQpxxTHN1s.description:
Requirements Tanessa has a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XyA6PKV46aNlLXOd]{Hand Crossbow} in each hand

Effect Tanessa quickly juggles her hand crossbows from one hand to another, reloading them both as she does so.
1d1wn0NQpxxTHN1s.name: Incredible Reload

5OiYfhHPstcj412O.description:
Tanessa can make Attacks of Opportunity with a loaded ranged weapon she's wielding if the triggering creature is within 5 feet of her.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]
5OiYfhHPstcj412O.name: Attack of Opportunity (Special)

doOqdxPdlJYa0GsX.description: Tanessa's ranged @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strikes} don't trigger Attacks of Opportunity or other triggered by ranged attacks.
doOqdxPdlJYa0GsX.name: Mobile Shot Stance

jpECNxPropkVu94M.description: Tanessa moves in a way that denies her enemies the opportunity to retaliate. When she takes a Stride action to move half her Speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions. She can use Mobility when Climbing, Flying, or Swimming instead of Striding if she has the corresponding movement type.
jpECNxPropkVu94M.name: Mobility

pr00tZKsLorUCDcD.description:
Tanessa designates as her prey a single creature that she can see and hear or that she is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Tracking}.

She gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when she @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeks} her prey and a +2 circumstance bonus to Survival checks when she @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Tracks} her prey. She also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within her second range increment against her prey. Lastly, she deals 1d8 precision damage to her prey the first time she hits her prey each round. Tanessa can have only one prey designated at a time.
pr00tZKsLorUCDcD.name: Hunt Prey

0ADnKFiKMszSKZaF.description: Tashlock deals an extra 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

2AI929eLb9JZQxCU.description: Tashlock can move his full Speed when Sneaking.
2AI929eLb9JZQxCU.name: Swift Sneak

6CvKZvykGC9DRN7Z.description: Tashlock isn't off-guard to creatures of 12th level or lower that are hidden, undetected, flanking, or using surprise attack.
6CvKZvykGC9DRN7Z.name: Deny Advantage

EoheVjsQC39ZT9Ya.description: Tashlock Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.
EoheVjsQC39ZT9Ya.name: Quick Draw

GeB1CiKcc6g90OtZ.description: An invisibility potion is colorless and oddly lightweight. Upon drinking it, you gain the effects of a 2nd-rank invisibility spell.

dWxzw3v6njHLRsgV.description:
Trigger Tashlock is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker he can see

Effect Tashlock gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
dWxzw3v6njHLRsgV.name: Nimble Dodge

iWDeWv63BnPfzCqn.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Tashlock.
iWDeWv63BnPfzCqn.name: Surprise Attack

miu3o0Zxz1ZBSRci.description: When Tashlock rolls a failure on a Sneak action, he gets a success instead.
miu3o0Zxz1ZBSRci.name: Sneak Savant

q4nI7tSE0zcxhH3I.description: When Tashlock deals damage to a target on a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} until the end of Tashlock's next turn.
q4nI7tSE0zcxhH3I.name: Pierced Tendon

v6zCYm9g5DqHI81j.description:
Activate 1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.7UL8belWmo7U5YGM]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Lesser)}

2GPHZdvZjNrQX4S7.description: The Vanish Man doesn't have an alignment aura and cannot be detected by spells such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.QnTtGCAvdWRU4spv]{Detect Alignment}.
2GPHZdvZjNrQX4S7.name: Vanished Alignment

MWMoiiaCQn1JlcdB.description: The vanish man can take on the exact form of any Small, Medium, or Large humanoid whose face they carry in their bag of faces, changing their shape and physical features to precisely match that of the victim whose face they wear. This doesn't change the butcher's Speed or attack or damage bonuses with their Strikes.
MWMoiiaCQn1JlcdB.name: Change Shape

SaNPZ048iYwMkyBR.description:
Requirements The vanish man is within reach of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature

Effect The vanish man attempts a cleaver Strike or an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, the vanish man deals damage as if they had made a successful cleaver Strike against the creature and removes the creature's face. On a critical success, the damage doubles and the creature takes @Damage[4d6[bleed]]. Once its face is removed, the creature takes a permanent -4 status penalty to Charisma checks and Charisma-based skill checks. This penalty can be removed only if the victim recovers its face from the vanish man and has a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SnaLVgxZ9ryUFmUr]{Restoration} spell cast on it.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.NLjzI7gt6djXSoXc]{Effect: Remove Face}
SaNPZ048iYwMkyBR.name: Remove Face

gb1r1Z5H5PiFdqyV.description:
Requirements The vanish man is undetected by their target

Effect The vanish man Strides once and makes two cleaver Strikes against the target. During the Stride, they gain a +10-foot circumstance bonus to their Speed.
gb1r1Z5H5PiFdqyV.name: Sudden Slices

iMfJOLJk4i8ywGZb.description:
10 feet. @Check[will|dc:33]

This aura is suppressed while the Vanish Man is using Change Shape.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

55Ue9KoElZXuS8Dc.description: Thessekka @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact} to draw a bomb, then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strikes} with it.
55Ue9KoElZXuS8Dc.name: Quick Bomber

6Q3lgvUWzPKUKxeH.description: This mobile collection of vials and chemicals can be used for simple alchemical tasks.
6Q3lgvUWzPKUKxeH.name: Expert Alchemist's Tools

6qV8HNnpHA2TjjBA.description:
Activate A Strike

This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, 3d6 persistent acid damage, and 3 acid splash damage. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls.
6qV8HNnpHA2TjjBA.name: Acid Flask (Greater) (Infused)

6yZT0Oua0CQQmx9r.description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 3d8 fire damage, 3 persistent fire damage, and 3 fire splash damage. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls.
6yZT0Oua0CQQmx9r.name: Alchemist's Fire (Greater) (Infused)

9KjQBibdPnAX1HTL.description: Thessekka turns her own body into solid stone like a statue and immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified}. Any creature grappled or restrained by her becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}; to get free, the creature must damage the statue enough to break it or succeed at a @Check[acrobatics|dc:36|name:Escape Stone Throes|traits:action:escape] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}. The only action Thessekka can take while petrified is to use Stone Throes again to end the effect.
9KjQBibdPnAX1HTL.name: Stone Throes

FzdAA0olz3ivmV27.description:
Activate A Interact

This flask of foaming beer grants courage. For the next hour after drinking this elixir, you gain a +2 item bonus to Will saves, or +3 when attempting Will saves against fear.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.eh7EqmDBDW30ShCu]{Effect: Bravo's Brew}
FzdAA0olz3ivmV27.name: Bravo's Brew (Moderate) (Infused)

GwuYTbaFsnrpYXeU.description:
These brass goggles are engraved with flame patterns and have thick, heavy lenses.

While worn, they give you a +2 item bonus to Crafting checks to Craft alchemical items and a +2 item bonus to attack rolls with alchemical bombs.

You can also ignore lesser cover when making Strikes with alchemical bombs.

HTSkrC7WJF2LvhAY.description:
Activate A

Your features become thin and angular. You become swifter and nimbler, but your body also becomes fragile.

Benefit You gain a +3 item bonus to Acrobatics checks, Stealth checks, Thievery checks, Reflex saves, and Dexterity-based attack rolls, and you gain a +15 foot status bonus to your Speed.

Drawback You take damage equal to twice your level; you can't recover Hit Points lost this way by any means while the mutagen lasts. You take a -2 penalty to Fortitude saves.

Duration 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.2Bds6d4UGQZqYSZM]{Effect: Quicksilver Mutagen (Greater)}
HTSkrC7WJF2LvhAY.name: Quicksilver Mutagen (Greater) (Infused)

JyWVziAy6MCtn3Nb.description:
A formula book holds the formulas necessary to make items other than the common equipment from this chapter; alchemists typically get one for free. Each formula book can hold the formulas for up to 100 different items. Formulas can also appear on parchment sheets, tablets, and almost any other medium; there's no need for you to copy them into a specific book as long as you can keep them on hand to reference them.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.jC8GmH0Un6vDxdMj]{Acid Flask (Greater)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.n5yTlTs63o53n3k6]{Alchemist's Fire (Greater)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XWkeL34yJK6t5qUE]{Antidote (Greater)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.oCuwJ9IUDAuzsUwa]{Bravo's Brew (Moderate)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.OcBPjVplvy2GbQ8P]{Comprehension Elixir (Greater)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.intVPcEzbE9o4NQd]{Frost Vial (Greater)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.eQDTsetadI8u8Kc0]{Quicksilver Mutagen (Greater)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.YcvSw7Zn3oyqlJaw]{Stone Fist Elixir}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.5Qkz4RVJr2Kx3RL6]{Tanglefoot Bag (Greater)}
JyWVziAy6MCtn3Nb.name: Formula Book

S9rsAqZ6i0J68L8D.description: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.jC8GmH0Un6vDxdMj]{Acid Flask (Greater)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.n5yTlTs63o53n3k6]{Alchemist's Fire (Greater)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XWkeL34yJK6t5qUE]{Antidote (Greater)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.oCuwJ9IUDAuzsUwa]{Bravo's Brew (Moderate)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.OcBPjVplvy2GbQ8P]{Comprehension Elixir (Greater)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.intVPcEzbE9o4NQd]{Frost Vial (Greater)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.eQDTsetadI8u8Kc0]{Quicksilver Mutagen (Greater)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.YcvSw7Zn3oyqlJaw]{Stone Fist Elixir}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.5Qkz4RVJr2Kx3RL6]{Tanglefoot Bag (Greater)}
S9rsAqZ6i0J68L8D.name: Alchemical Formulas

TXbhRlWu7SAx8Ctw.description: 30 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:34] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}, and on a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as it is sickened. While within range of Thessekka's stench, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths' stenches for 1 minute.
TXbhRlWu7SAx8Ctw.name: Powerful Stench

X5jrkgJhRyd0x78g.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Thessekka commands nearby earth to attack a foe. Thessekka makes a claw Strike against a creature that is within 60 feet of her and 10 feet of an earthen surface, such as dirt, mud, stone, or sand. The Strike originates from the surface's square and has a reach of 10 feet. On a critical hit, the target is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
X5jrkgJhRyd0x78g.name: Earthen Blow

dweCpMS4m3DyGNS6.description:
Activate 1 Strike

A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances. When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a -15-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls, and the Escape DC is 28.

On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to Fly again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water.

The target can end any effects by Escaping or spending a total of 3 actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These Interact actions don't have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well.
dweCpMS4m3DyGNS6.name: Tanglefoot Bag (Greater) (Infused)

ee9wYp6ZD1nOsbJs.description:
Cost 1 batch of infused reagents

Effect Thessekka creates a single alchemical item from her formula book (see Alchemical Formulas). This item has the infused trait, but it remains potent only until the end of her next turn.
ee9wYp6ZD1nOsbJs.name: Quick Alchemy

kdKmscxdhMu94gTS.description:
Activate 1 Strike

The liquid reagents in this vial rapidly absorb heat when exposed to air. A frost vial deals the listed cold damage and cold splash damage. On a hit, the target takes a status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn. Many types of frost vial also grant an item bonus to attack rolls.

You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls, the bomb deals 3d6 cold damage and 3 cold splash damage, and the target takes a -10-foot penalty.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.nJRoiSyd67eQ1dYj]{Effect: Frost Vial (Greater)}
kdKmscxdhMu94gTS.name: Frost Vial (Greater) (Infused)

qLAXvZ1JTs2cxRUR.description: Thessekka's bombs with the splash trait deal 4 additional splash damage and deal splash damage to all creatures within 10 feet.
qLAXvZ1JTs2cxRUR.name: Expanded Splash

qsR9Zyfw0HbieQM9.description:
Frequency once per minute

Requirements Thessekka is standing on or next to at least 10 cubic feet of dirt, stone, or other earthen material

Effect Thessekka creates a violent wave of roiling earth. Creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:15] take @Damage[10d10[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic] save; on a critical failure, creatures are also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}).
qsR9Zyfw0HbieQM9.name: Earthen Torrent

wv4csg9YxPFOP1Pm.description: Thessekka carries the following infused items: 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.jC8GmH0Un6vDxdMj]{Acid Flask (Greater)}, 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.n5yTlTs63o53n3k6]{Alchemist's Fire (Greater)}, 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.oCuwJ9IUDAuzsUwa]{Bravo's Brew (Moderate)}, 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.intVPcEzbE9o4NQd]{Frost Vial (Greater)}, 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.eQDTsetadI8u8Kc0]{Quicksilver Mutagen (Greater)}, 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.5Qkz4RVJr2Kx3RL6]{Tanglefoot Bag (Greater)}. These items last for 24 hours, or until the next time Thessekka makes her daily preparations.
wv4csg9YxPFOP1Pm.name: Infused Items

Thief's Trap.description: Nearly imperceptible runes set off an explosion at the point a thief is most unable to receive aid.
Thief's Trap.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:45|name:Counteract the Runes|traits:magical,trap] (master) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (10th level, counteract DC 50) to counteract the runes
Thief's Trap.name: Thief's Trap

Thunderstone Cascade Trap.description: A trip wire halfway up the stairs releases half a dozen spherical thunderstones that bounce down the stairs and explode.

Xmcr4PwRCrFQgjVC.description:
Ulthadar can't move on to the afterlife until Moonstone Hall is restored to a position of prominence within Escadar and staffed with new priests.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.
Xmcr4PwRCrFQgjVC.name: Rejuvenation

erJjvQ0PRlmb1VLz.description: 30 feet. Creatures entering the aura or starting their turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:26] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute. On a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}. As a reflection of Ulthadar's emotional state, this aura is active when Ulthadar is agitated or angry and is suppressed when he is calm.
erJjvQ0PRlmb1VLz.name: Existential Agony

wKH8WPFicTjEMDpB.description: Ulthadar attempts to drain a living creature's life force. He makes a ghostly hand Strike but deals no damage on a hit. Instead, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} for 1 day and Ulthadar regains [[/r 4[healing]]]{4 Hit Points}.
wKH8WPFicTjEMDpB.name: Draining Touch

Urdefhan Dominator.description:
Urdefhan dominators control the minds of others to glean useful secrets and gain an advantage against their enemies.

Urdefhans believe themselves to be spawn of the First Horseman of the Apocalypse, who planted them on the Material Plane to serve as harbingers of the end times. These warmongering humanoids live in groups called cults in the Darklands vaults of Orv.

3LzPeJJxCoxD2Roq.description:
When an urdefhan dies, its invisible flesh quickly rots away and sublimates into a foul-smelling gas that fills a @Template[emanation|distance:5] around the body.

This gas deals @Damage[15d6[void]] damage to creatures in this area as their flesh curdles and rots as well (@Check[fortitude|dc:34|basic] save).
3LzPeJJxCoxD2Roq.name: Necrotic Decay

L7PvaYLhErs0eOxg.description:
Requirements The urdefhan damaged a creature with a jaws Strike on its last action

Effect The urdefhan maintains contact, turning the creature's flesh translucent around the site of the injury. The urdefhan chooses one of two options, each of which requires a @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save. If the jaws Strike was a critical hit, the creature suffers both effects, using the same save result for both.

  • Drain Blood The urdefhan drinks some of the creature's blood. On a failed save, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the urdefhan regains [[/r 5[healing]]]{5 HP} (or, on a critical failure, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the urdefhan regains [[/r 10[healing]]]{10 HP}).
  • Drain Vitality (necromancy) The urdefhan draws out some of the creature's vital essence. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 hour on a failed save (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 hour on a critical failure).
L7PvaYLhErs0eOxg.name: Wicked Bite

QT4UShVoztc5IRSM.description:
Requirements The urdefhan dominator has a creature dominated with its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} innate spell

Effect The urdefhan taps into the dominated creature's sight, hearing, and any other senses it has. The urdefhan can change back and forth from its own senses to the target's senses as a single action, which has the concentrate trait.
QT4UShVoztc5IRSM.name: Eyes of the Enthralled

Urdefhan Dominator.name: Urdefhan Dominator

Urdefhan High Tormentor.description:
An urdefhan cult's best tormentors can advance to become truly formidable daemon summoners.

Urdefhans believe themselves to be spawn of the First Horseman of the Apocalypse, who planted them on the Material Plane to serve as harbingers of the end times. These warmongering humanoids live in groups called cults in the Darklands vaults of Orv

The violent warmongers, occultists, and poisoners known as urdefhans dwell within the Darklands. They were created in eons past by the mysterious First Horsemen of the Apocalypse to serve as agents of the end times within the Material Plane. Urdefhans continue to honor their creators by worshipping the wretched beings who rule over the plane of Abaddon, and like their fiendish lieges, urdefhans exist for one reason and one reason alone: to kill.

While urdefhans are humanoid and dwell together in large groups, this is where their similarities to surface ancestries end. Their visages are horrific, with transparent skin and musculature displaying their glistening entrails, gleaming bones, and perhaps worst of all, their baleful red eyes. This, combined with their gaping maws full of sharp fangs, works to create the false impression that these beings are some sort of vampiric undead, not creatures of living flesh and blood. When an urdefhan's life comes to an end, their flesh quickly curdles and then bursts in a wave of awful corruption that spreads to the flesh of other creatures in the area. The typical urdefhan views their eventual demise as a disappointment, for once they're dead, their chances to kill will finally come to an end.

Urdefhans' primary concern is death and how to inflict it in the goriest, most painful, and widespread ways. Beyond this ethos of violence, urdefhans concern themselves only tangentially with matters such as formal modes of warfare or aspects of their damnable religion. When an urdefhan is not actively engaged in violence, their giddy cruelty is tempered only by a sense of self-preservation that ensures they survive long enough to spread the "blessings" of their daemonic patrons. They pass the time between wars inventing new weapons, developing new diseases, and researching awful new magic, all in preparation for the next inevitable conflict.

YC6l2GTlJST6HmzF.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The urdefhan lets out a battle cry, sending itself and its allies into a fanatical frenzy. Each ally that hears the call gains a +4 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls, a +2 status bonus to saving throws, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. Affected allies must use at least one of their actions to Strike each round, if they are able (even if it means attacking an ally, object, or thin air).

This lasts for [[/br 2d4 #rounds]]{2d4 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.J6EwMsXtXg30eaiB]{Effect: Stoke the Fervent (High Tormentor)}

The urdefhan chooses one of two options, each of which requires a @Check[fortitude|dc:29] save. If the jaws Strike was a critical hit, the creature suffers both effects, using the same save result for both.

  • Drain Blood The urdefhan drinks some of the creature's blood. On a failed save, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the urdefhan regains [[/r 5[healing]]]{5 HP} (or, on a critical failure, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the urdefhan regains [[/r 10[healing]]]{10 HP}).
  • Drain Vitality (necromancy) The urdefhan draws out some of the creature's vital essence. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 hour on a failed save (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 hour on a critical failure).
fQBkHuE4KEzg86Bk.name: Wicked Bite

When an urdefhan dies, its invisible flesh quickly rots away and sublimates into a foul-smelling gas that fills a @Template[emanation|distance:5] around the body.

This gas deals @Damage[10d6[void]] damage to creatures in this area as their flesh curdles and rots as well (@Check[fortitude|dc:29|basic] save).

Urdefhan Hunter.description:
Urdefhan hunters serve as their cults' trappers, hunters, and poachers. Many urdefhan hunters use skavelings to traverse the massive caverns of the Darklands and scout for prey.

Urdefhans believe themselves to be spawn of the First Horseman of the Apocalypse, who planted them on the Material Plane to serve as harbingers of the end times. These warmongering humanoids live in groups called cults in the Darklands vaults of Orv.

1W3SqzQpvwlpRf5W.description:
Requirements The urdefhan hunter is wielding a ranged weapon with reload 0

2mOCKRrDP2pm8VSK.description:

Ba3OUInVSq7YCdrO.description: Urdefhan hunters can make composite longbow Strikes while mounted.
